subject: Fixes k8s FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-12 15:55:11.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-minion.sh'], 'message': 'Fixes k8s FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning

This commit fixes FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning under kubectl
node events which is not supposed to appear under default settings
pointed out in Kubernetes docs:

    https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/reserve-compute-resources/#enabling-qos-and-pod-level-cgroups.

This is addressed by passing cgroups-per-qos and
enforce-node-allocatable arguments to KUBELET_ARGS when kube worker
nodes are being configured.

Closes-Bug: #1763405

Change-Id: I452840eebb955be9fd178b582be74242e949b662
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes k8s FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning

This commit fixes FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning under kubectl
node events which is not supposed to appear under default settings
pointed out in Kubernetes docs:

    https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/reserve-compute-resources/#enabling-qos-and-pod-level-cgroups.

This is addressed by passing cgroups-per-qos and
enforce-node-allocatable arguments to KUBELET_ARGS when kube worker
nodes are being configured.

Closes-Bug: #1763405

Change-Id: I452840eebb955be9fd178b582be74242e949b662

commit_message:
Update converge workflow to remove no-ops

The no-opped DeploymentSteps need to be re-added after we're done with
minor update.

Related:
  python-tripleoclient I9656d8c6137fb656aecda7d13768ca4ab3c10b1f

Partial-Bug: #1760898

subject: Make specifying the nic optional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-17 10:18:54.000000000', 'files': ['common.py', 'requires.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Make specifying the nic optional

If a nic is not specified when setting up a vip resource then
corosync should just do the right thing. This change makes the nic
field optional as there is little benefit in using it.

Change-Id: I022a43df0a50a21df3c5f021dcd563da4d20db53
'}]
commit_message:
Make specifying the nic optional

If a nic is not specified when setting up a vip resource then
corosync should just do the right thing. This change makes the nic
field optional as there is little benefit in using it.

Change-Id: I022a43df0a50a21df3c5f021dcd563da4d20db53

subject: Add libre2 for project-config linting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-17 10:00:52.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': "Add libre2 for project-config linting

tox.ini pulls in zuul, but we don't actually install the zuul bindeps.
Zuul has added a requirement on fb-re2 with
Id1b9d7334db78d0f13db33d47a80ffdb65f921df which requires these
libraries.

Change-Id: Ifafdb33752a3bafb5946810878654b0c20d0577c
"}]
commit_message:
Add libre2 for project-config linting

tox.ini pulls in zuul, but we don't actually install the zuul bindeps.
Zuul has added a requirement on fb-re2 with
Id1b9d7334db78d0f13db33d47a80ffdb65f921df which requires these
libraries.

Change-Id: Ifafdb33752a3bafb5946810878654b0c20d0577c

commit_message:
Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966
Change-Id: I8bf80efc04883cd754c19bea0303064080112c6e
(cherry picked from commit f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c)

commit_message:
Revert config-download mappings in upgrade converge step

We need to restore the default mappings for the resources remapped
by config-download during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I6fe16ad01a299a6e1c13138cee3702827708b19f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-16 14:00:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_tempest_plugin/api/admin/test_shared_network_extension.py'], 'message': '[API] Test set network as not shared where used via RBAC rule

This patch adds test which checks if network can be set as
not shared in case if it is used by some other than owner
project via specified RBAC rule.

commit_message:
[API] Test set network as not shared where used via RBAC rule

This patch adds test which checks if network can be set as
not shared in case if it is used by some other than owner
project via specified RBAC rule.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561589
Change-Id: Ie483fa1abbe403f28ec56d86e986984902810b05
Related-bug: #1764330

subject: bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-17 09:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bagpipe/agent/bagpipe_ml2/agent_extension.py', 'networking_bagpipe/tests/unit/agent/bagpipe_ml2/test_agent_extension.py'], 'message': 'bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port

The agent extension for bagpipe ML2 was calling do_port_plug_refresh
before having removed the port from internal datastructure, hence
causing the detach_port to be followed by a bogus attach_port.

This change fixes the code and the unit test.

Change-Id: Ie0786855a1e67c163c9710c10e5539aceb56ab08
Closes-Bug: 1764702
'}]
commit_message:
bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port

The agent extension for bagpipe ML2 was calling do_port_plug_refresh
before having removed the port from internal datastructure, hence
causing the detach_port to be followed by a bogus attach_port.

This change fixes the code and the unit test.

Change-Id: Ie0786855a1e67c163c9710c10e5539aceb56ab08
Closes-Bug: 1764702

commit_message:
tests: don't configure plugin for tests that don't need it

Except test_subnet, there are no more object tests that would require
the plugin configured, so let's not go through the hassle of setting it
up. (For the record, this setup was not needed since
If1252c42c49cd59dba7ec7c02c9b887fdc169f51).

Change-Id: Iafb886c17dbf9a91a3514b0caa1bcd14093a796c

subject: Change clients_keystone/auth_uri default to public Keystone URL
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-14 15:31:14.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/change_clients_keystone_auth_uri_default-72ba554b846f2193.yaml', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Change clients_keystone/auth_uri default to public Keystone URL

By default, the ::heat class configures clients_keystone/auth_uri to the
value of ::heat::keystone::authtoken::auth_url, which is generally the
admin endpoint on port 35357.

However, since this URI can be used by non-admin clients running inside
instances, such as os-collect-config, a better default value would be to
use either the public or internal Keystone endpoint, depending on the
deployment. This commit changes the default to the public Keystone
endpoint defined in ::heat::keystone::authtoken::www_authenticate_uri.

It is still possible to provide a custom value using the
heat_clients_keystone_uri parameter.

Change-Id: Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b
Closes-Bug: #1763700
'}]
commit_message:
Change clients_keystone/auth_uri default to public Keystone URL

By default, the ::heat class configures clients_keystone/auth_uri to the
value of ::heat::keystone::authtoken::auth_url, which is generally the
admin endpoint on port 35357.

However, since this URI can be used by non-admin clients running inside
instances, such as os-collect-config, a better default value would be to
use either the public or internal Keystone endpoint, depending on the
deployment. This commit changes the default to the public Keystone
endpoint defined in ::heat::keystone::authtoken::www_authenticate_uri.

It is still possible to provide a custom value using the
heat_clients_keystone_uri parameter.

Change-Id: Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b
Closes-Bug: #1763700

Our doc requirements have been updated to run documentation builds
using sphinx-build instead of calling tox. The PTI reference for

commit_message:
Update docs job info to match current PTI

Our doc requirements have been updated to run documentation builds
using sphinx-build instead of calling tox. The PTI reference for
Python code still contained old recommendations to use
[build_sphinx] in setup.cfg. This updates this Python recommendation
to match what is stated in the full PTI with additions for making
local runs easier through using tox.

Change-Id: Ibdaeefdac6b6bbeef544778d2fa5c3972d180cb8

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-08 10:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Add puppet-senlin to Puppet OpenStack

"Senlin is a clustering service for OpenStack clouds. It creates and operates
clusters of homogeneous objects exposed by other OpenStack services. The
goal is to make the orchestration of collections of similar objects easier.

Senlin provides RESTful APIs to users so that they can associate various
policies to a cluster.  Sample policies include placement policy, load
balancing policy, health policy, scaling policy, update policy and so on.

Senlin is designed to be capable of managing different types of objects. An
object's lifecycle is managed using profile type implementations, which are
themselves plugins."

More information about Senlin project:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Senlin

We started to work on the Puppet senlin module that installs and
configures Senlin services.

Change-Id: I53b62c6874da44215a89b56f57c44f954aeab057
Depends-On: Ic4272d28016b95006f6c31c41f60c9111ebb2c91
'}]
commit_message:
Add puppet-senlin to Puppet OpenStack

"Senlin is a clustering service for OpenStack clouds. It creates and operates
clusters of homogeneous objects exposed by other OpenStack services. The
goal is to make the orchestration of collections of similar objects easier.

Senlin provides RESTful APIs to users so that they can associate various
policies to a cluster.  Sample policies include placement policy, load
balancing policy, health policy, scaling policy, update policy and so on.

Senlin is designed to be capable of managing different types of objects. An
object's lifecycle is managed using profile type implementations, which are
themselves plugins."

More information about Senlin project:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Senlin

We started to work on the Puppet senlin module that installs and
configures Senlin services.

Change-Id: I53b62c6874da44215a89b56f57c44f954aeab057

subject: unbreak unit tests: pecan.jsonify 1.3 adjustment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-17 07:32:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/api/v2/test_base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_providernet.py', 'neutron/tests/tools.py'], 'message': "unbreak unit tests: pecan.jsonify 1.3 adjustment

From pecan 1.3, pecan.jsonify uses json.Encoder unconditionally so that
jsonifying mock fails.
Pecan 1.2 uses simplejosn.Encoder as encoder which accidentally encodes
MagicMock as {} due to check of '_asdict' attributes.
Since pecan.jsonify uses __json__ magic method when it's defined,
add __json__ method to mocks to return {} as json encode.

Change-Id: I07ad74142ad781a079dc5c9cac0f21ca42b5c59a
"}]
commit_message:
unbreak unit tests: pecan.jsonify 1.3 adjustment

From pecan 1.3, pecan.jsonify uses json.Encoder unconditionally so that
jsonifying mock fails.
Pecan 1.2 uses simplejosn.Encoder as encoder which accidentally encodes
MagicMock as {} due to check of '_asdict' attributes.
Since pecan.jsonify uses __json__ magic method when it's defined,
add __json__ method to mocks to return {} as json encode.

Change-Id: I07ad74142ad781a079dc5c9cac0f21ca42b5c59a

subject: Fix ContainerBroker.empty()
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-04-12 12:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Fix ContainerBroker.empty()

Previously ContainerBroker.empty did not check the contents of the
fresh db for misplaced objects when in sharded state, and did not
consider the content of a retiring db while sharding. Consequently it
was possible to delete a sharding container, or a sharded container
with only misplaced objects.

Own shard range was also erroneously included when considering shard
range object counts.

Now the method checks that both fresh and any retiring db are empty
and that there is zero shard range usage.

Change-Id: I5b77e54c9ce2b6546feacbe856bf944a18f9b29d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ContainerBroker.empty()

Previously ContainerBroker.empty did not check the contents of the
fresh db for misplaced objects when in sharded state, and did not
consider the content of a retiring db while sharding. Consequently it
was possible to delete a sharding container, or a sharded container
with only misplaced objects.

Own shard range was also erroneously included when considering shard
range object counts.

Now the method checks that both fresh and any retiring db are empty
and that there is zero shard range usage.

Change-Id: I5b77e54c9ce2b6546feacbe856bf944a18f9b29d

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Amend lower constraints according to tools/fix-lower-constraints.py and
removed qpid-python from requirements.txt to fix requirements job.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic1f4de4b5f36cfe5bd5e578507e320918d1078f9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Modify libvirt port range for live-migration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-16 07:54:24.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/migration/qemu.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_migration_qemu_spec.rb'], 'message': "Modify libvirt port range for live-migration

By default, libvirtd uses ports 49152 to 49215 for live-migration,
as specified in qemu.conf

Since these ports is subset to ephemeral port range, which is from
32768 to 61000 for linux, it can be consumed by any other service
as well. It causes live-migration to fail, with below error:

Live Migration failure: internal error: Unable to find an unused
port in range 'migration' (49152-49215)

Moved the default port range out of ephemeral port range, so that
it can be consumed only for live-migration by libvirtd.

Change-Id: I4834743d8eeb53fe87ea797cbcdb1c5a5b04101f
"}]
commit_message:
Modify libvirt port range for live-migration

By default, libvirtd uses ports 49152 to 49215 for live-migration,
as specified in qemu.conf

Since these ports is subset to ephemeral port range, which is from
32768 to 61000 for linux, it can be consumed by any other service
as well. It causes live-migration to fail, with below error:

Live Migration failure: internal error: Unable to find an unused
port in range 'migration' (49152-49215)

Moved the default port range out of ephemeral port range, so that
it can be consumed only for live-migration by libvirtd.

Change-Id: I4834743d8eeb53fe87ea797cbcdb1c5a5b04101f

commit_message:
Fix backwards incompatibility with auth_uri

Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b switches to use
www_authenticate_uri but it is not backwards incompatible for folks who
have yet to switch to use www_authenticate_uri. We should still support
auth_uri for the time beaing.

Change-Id: I132fa8ebf91e932cd7fbc610dccd332348d52d49
Closes-Bug: #1764598

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 18:55:11.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Add deadlock retry decorator to gc_by_engine

gc_by_engine calls _mark_failed. Because _mark_failed performs
deletions, it can potentially deadlock.

action_mark_failed also calls _mark_failed and is already protected
using deadlock retry decorator.

This change adds the deadlock retry decorator to gc_by_engine to prevent

'}]
commit_message:
Add deadlock retry decorator to gc_by_engine

gc_by_engine calls _mark_failed. Because _mark_failed performs
deletions, it can potentially deadlock.

action_mark_failed also calls _mark_failed and is already protected
using deadlock retry decorator.

This change adds the deadlock retry decorator to gc_by_engine to prevent
potential deadlocks.

Change-Id: Iaf00a5cbb56cac9ab08d601e69924e8a7974486f

subject: Temporarily disable redirection with TLS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 04:40:28.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy/endpoint.pp'], 'message': "Temporarily disable redirection with TLS

If Public TLS is enabled, non-TLS requests made to the public IP are
redirected to use TLS. This is fine for most cases but are quite
problematic when we're in the process of moving to TLS by default. So
I'm disabling this while the tripleo-common [1] and the t-h-t [2]
changes that enable TLS by default merge.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554926/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558424/

Change-Id: I2a0cdb483203cfeaaa64cc0f51d95d268fb99d32
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily disable redirection with TLS

If Public TLS is enabled, non-TLS requests made to the public IP are
redirected to use TLS. This is fine for most cases but are quite
problematic when we're in the process of moving to TLS by default. So
I'm disabling this while the tripleo-common [1] and the t-h-t [2]
changes that enable TLS by default merge.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554926/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558424/

Change-Id: I2a0cdb483203cfeaaa64cc0f51d95d268fb99d32

subject: HAProxy: Redirect to TLS port
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-12 07:59:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy/endpoint.pp'], 'message': "HAProxy: Redirect to TLS port

The way we did redirection, we got everything coming to the public IP
and redirected the connection to use TLS. This didn't take into account
that the port might change when using TLS. So this fixes that. This is
specially useful when using only the ctlplane network (multinode jobs),
since the public IP is the same as the rest.

Change-Id: I4f25c6293eb5ff75707c5f1e48670c83138e809a
"}]
commit_message:
HAProxy: Redirect to TLS port

The way we did redirection, we got everything coming to the public IP
and redirected the connection to use TLS. This didn't take into account
that the port might change when using TLS. So this fixes that. This is
specially useful when using only the ctlplane network (multinode jobs),
since the public IP is the same as the rest.

Change-Id: I4f25c6293eb5ff75707c5f1e48670c83138e809a

commit_message:
RabbitMQ: recover from full cluster restart

This PS updates the RabbitMQ chart to name nodes via their hostnames
rather than IPs - allowing the cluster (and single nodes) to be
restarted without impact.

Additionally the rabbitmq managment interface is exposed and basic
helm tests have been added.

Change-Id: I84857d9f3697eaa8491aafaf6ee3b9d47dbf2191

commit_message:
Load custom drivers from config option

This commit adds support to load custom driver endpoints from config file.
New option 'custom_driver_endpoints' is added for the same.

Eg: custom_driver_endpoints = 'test=congress.datasources.test_driver:TestDriver'

Implements blueprint enable-drivers-by-default

Change-Id: I465301213734b9d4d7e5f7d67bae1d08767d9f16

subject: DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 7016, 'name': 'Swaminathan Vasudevan', 'email': 'swvasude@cisco.com', 'username': 'souminathan'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-09 23:45:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py'], 'message': "DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface

When l3 agent is restarted on a dvr_snat node that is configured
for L3_HA and has a centralized FloatingIP configured to the
qg-interface in the snat_namespace, that FloatingIP is not
re-configured to the qg-interface when agent starts.

The reason being, the cidr is not being retrieved from the
keepalived instance and only retrieved from the
centralized_fip_cidr_set.

If 'L3_HA' is configured we need to retrieve it from the keepalived
instance.

This patch fixes the problem by retrieving the cidrs from the
keepalived instance for the qg-interface.

Change-Id: I848a20d06e2d344503a4cb1776dbe2617d91bc41
Closes-Bug: #1740450
(cherry picked from commit 64028a389ff904f15e471b44bd5b3979c5db2cd2)
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface

When l3 agent is restarted on a dvr_snat node that is configured
for L3_HA and has a centralized FloatingIP configured to the
qg-interface in the snat_namespace, that FloatingIP is not
re-configured to the qg-interface when agent starts.

The reason being, the cidr is not being retrieved from the
keepalived instance and only retrieved from the
centralized_fip_cidr_set.

If 'L3_HA' is configured we need to retrieve it from the keepalived
instance.

This patch fixes the problem by retrieving the cidrs from the
keepalived instance for the qg-interface.

Change-Id: I848a20d06e2d344503a4cb1776dbe2617d91bc41
Closes-Bug: #1740450
(cherry picked from commit 64028a389ff904f15e471b44bd5b3979c5db2cd2)

commit_message:
Remove RequestContext.instance_lock_checked

This was initially added in change I1127e31d86a061a93a64ee1eb4a4d900d8bf49b5
but is no longer used anywhere in nova since change
Ic18017a16c5bffee85a43db65ff17283599a27ba.

Anyway, this change still allows it to be passed as a kwarg for now but will
emit a UserWarning if it is, and then we can make it a hard failure starting
in the S release.

Change-Id: Ib0b23a47c2e833073108af6700b16f8026631a83

subject: Partially revert "Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-15 17:54:19.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': 'Partially revert "Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip"

This reverts the manifests/haproxy.pp parts of
commit 4c7ca4cbc385fa70438015ebc91b8692c00d46e7.

The reverted commit made it such that you can not set a
hostname as undercloud_public_host in undercloud.conf. This
is required so that the UI can be accessed by hostname
externally as well as to make the Undercloud API accessible
externally. We keep the parts of that change that verify if
the haproxy VIP for pacemaker is a proper IP as it can
happen that a misconfigured network template causes empty
strings and the deploy will fail in a very odd way.

Change-Id: I57eeb2dd26336465627593d633c63b92da42e71d
Closes-Bug: #1763776
'}]
commit_message:
Partially revert "Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip"

This reverts the manifests/haproxy.pp parts of
commit 4c7ca4cbc385fa70438015ebc91b8692c00d46e7.

The reverted commit made it such that you can not set a
hostname as undercloud_public_host in undercloud.conf. This
is required so that the UI can be accessed by hostname
externally as well as to make the Undercloud API accessible
externally. We keep the parts of that change that verify if
the haproxy VIP for pacemaker is a proper IP as it can
happen that a misconfigured network template causes empty
strings and the deploy will fail in a very odd way.

Change-Id: I57eeb2dd26336465627593d633c63b92da42e71d
Closes-Bug: #1763776

commit_message:
Allow vhost socket directory user/group as configurable from template

For ovs2.8 version, it is required to modify the vhost socket directory
permissions as openvswitch:hugetlbfs instead of the earlier hardcoded
values qemu:qemu. Making these values as input which could be configured
from templates.

Change-Id: Ia2d0a49567f51b8e6ecdf1967c515ef0dfe81567
(cherry picked from commit 361785f14d9965b0f81706dfbe3a01550a110b1a)

from templates.

commit_message:
Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130
(cherry picked from commit db081a75c5d2b7a99b4b796f9de7a4aadd7ab522)
(cherry picked from commit 08a0f081bf627ef09b934b2cc1dc66e172a1dbd4)

commit_message:
Don't merge repo changes from different branches

when using reproducer script and cloning repos with changes,
ignore those changes that are coming from different branches.
It filters out backported dependencies if they are in ZUUL_CHANGES

Change-Id: If525e3db07976cd8d010074b22129ccec9dd09f7

subject: Eliminate Scan-Done sysmeta
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-16 14:00:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/overview_container_sharding.rst', 'swift/cli/manage_shard_ranges.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py'], 'message': 'Eliminate Scan-Done sysmeta

The scan-done sysmeta is not required since the same info can be
inferred from the shard range table. Also refactor _cleave and change
return value to avoid confusion i.e. return indicates when *all*
cleaving is complete.

Store cleaving_context progress as each chard range is cleaved rather
than at end of a batch.

Change-Id: I90be4ada8fefbf3dda12fdf5dca46fb405a95a6a
'}]
commit_message:
Eliminate Scan-Done sysmeta

The scan-done sysmeta is not required since the same info can be
inferred from the shard range table. Also refactor _cleave and change
return value to avoid confusion i.e. return indicates when *all*
cleaving is complete.

Store cleaving_context progress as each chard range is cleaved rather
than at end of a batch.

Change-Id: I90be4ada8fefbf3dda12fdf5dca46fb405a95a6a

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints to make them match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Add SUSE's zypper example alongside yum and apt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 00:56:44.000000000', 'files': ['doc/training-guides/source/slides/04-using-with-cli.rst'], 'message': "Add SUSE's zypper example alongside yum and apt

The instalation docs all support SUSE versions, and the
openstackclient installation instructions goes to the effort
of giving an example with 'apt' and 'yum' so add 'zypper' as
well in case someone in the training is running OpenSUSE, SLES
or SLED.

The patch slightly re-arranges the slide to get all the
package managers on 1 slide. We could try and rearrange and
simple add more slides.

Disclaimer, SUSE is my employer and saw it was missing, so

Change-Id: Ieb5e43e937c51c4b7cbd845ee1520f9fecb8a5c1

commit_message:
Add SUSE's zypper example alongside yum and apt

The instalation docs all support SUSE versions, and the
openstackclient installation instructions goes to the effort
of giving an example with 'apt' and 'yum' so add 'zypper' as
well in case someone in the training is running OpenSUSE, SLES
or SLED.

The patch slightly re-arranges the slide to get all the
package managers on 1 slide. We could try and rearrange and
simple add more slides.

Disclaimer, SUSE is my employer and saw it was missing, so
this is a drive by change.

Change-Id: Ieb5e43e937c51c4b7cbd845ee1520f9fecb8a5c1

commit_message:
Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

Change-Id: I0fa3934b345d51de85fd9d8a5a211b8e1bc50d86
(cherry picked from commit 87e9b300045bb708baf1f0216e6261470de3f04f)

commit_message:
Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.

which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

subject: Use consistent role schema in token response validation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-12 22:01:44.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3.py'], 'message': "Use consistent role schema in token response validation

The tests used a different schema for the roles in the token
response schema for different token scopes. The role information
shouldn't change depending on the scope, so let's make the test
more DRY by not redefining the role schema in multiple places.

Related-Bug: 1763510
Change-Id: I58d3dc2a3306994890688d5ff40a62cdaedf378e
"}]
commit_message:
Use consistent role schema in token response validation

The tests used a different schema for the roles in the token
response schema for different token scopes. The role information
shouldn't change depending on the scope, so let's make the test
more DRY by not redefining the role schema in multiple places.

Related-Bug: 1763510
Change-Id: I58d3dc2a3306994890688d5ff40a62cdaedf378e

subject: Start from last max row when repeating cleaving
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2018-04-16 14:00:22.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "Start from last max row when repeating cleaving

When cleaving is completed but the max row of the retiring db has
changed then cleaving is repeated to avoid losing any rows recently
added to the retiring db.  Previously this meant cleaving every row in
the retiring db again, which is unnecessary and inefficient.  Now only
rows that were added since the last cleaving pass began are cleaved on
a subsequent cleaving pass.

This change requires the cleaving context to be keyed by retiring db
id alone. Previously the db max row id was used in the context key, so
that if the max row changed a new context would automatically be
generated. Now, the max row id is included in the context and the
context is explicitly reset when re-cleaving is required. Note that
the context is still specific to a single replica of the db.

In support of this change, the cleaving context is now encapsulated in
a CleavingContext class. The state being maintained is now
sufficiently rich to warrant a class to ease state manipulation and
testing.  This also separates cleaving context concerns out of the
ContainerBroker, which now simply provides a means to store serialized
cleaving context data.

To complete the separation of concerns, the checks made on cleaving
context prior to changing a broker's db state to SHARDED are moved
from the ContainerBroker to the sharder daemon. This also removes the
need for tedious cleaving context setup in tests to simply get a broker
into sharded state.

Change-Id: Ibe3b1e9d69738a4aad23ade7b28fc534eb5786c9
"}]
commit_message:
Start from last max row when repeating cleaving

When cleaving is completed but the max row of the retiring db has
changed then cleaving is repeated to avoid losing any rows recently
added to the retiring db.  Previously this meant cleaving every row in
the retiring db again, which is unnecessary and inefficient.  Now only
rows that were added since the last cleaving pass began are cleaved on
a subsequent cleaving pass.

This change requires the cleaving context to be keyed by retiring db
id alone. Previously the db max row id was used in the context key, so
that if the max row changed a new context would automatically be
generated. Now, the max row id is included in the context and the
context is explicitly reset when re-cleaving is required. Note that
the context is still specific to a single replica of the db.

In support of this change, the cleaving context is now encapsulated in
a CleavingContext class. The state being maintained is now
sufficiently rich to warrant a class to ease state manipulation and
testing.  This also separates cleaving context concerns out of the
ContainerBroker, which now simply provides a means to store serialized
cleaving context data.

To complete the separation of concerns, the checks made on cleaving
context prior to changing a broker's db state to SHARDED are moved
from the ContainerBroker to the sharder daemon. This also removes the
need for tedious cleaving context setup in tests to simply get a broker
into sharded state.

Change-Id: Ibe3b1e9d69738a4aad23ade7b28fc534eb5786c9

Previously the default value for the heat-engine workers setting was set
to $::os_service_default. We usually use our specific facts for the
worker settings so this change switches it to use the
$::os_worker_heat_engine fact.

Change-Id: I6a8d745b76afca1b1958816fa10a3f1dd30face6
Related-Bug: #1763671
(cherry picked from commit 8adb596e33de96422ab9858aa5d4984378dce601)
'}]
commit_message:
Switch heat-engine workers to use os_workers_heat_engine

Previously the default value for the heat-engine workers setting was set
to $::os_service_default. We usually use our specific facts for the
worker settings so this change switches it to use the
$::os_worker_heat_engine fact.

Change-Id: I6a8d745b76afca1b1958816fa10a3f1dd30face6
Related-Bug: #1763671
(cherry picked from commit 8adb596e33de96422ab9858aa5d4984378dce601)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install neutron now directly from pypi
- or use the current branch in CI system using tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to
requirements file.

Change-Id: I416acf75c3db3cdf202a6bc49d96d1abb73b2d6e

are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I15006f3d958c0d376d6832be086f8a5e16cbcf9f

subject: Update environment files for Q upgrade and ffwd upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 12:21:21.000000000', 'files': ['environments/lifecycle/ffwd-upgrade-converge.yaml', 'environments/lifecycle/ffwd-upgrade-prepare.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-converge-docker.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-composable-steps.yaml', 'environments/fast-forward-upgrade.yaml', 'environments/lifecycle/upgrade-converge.yaml', 'environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-converge.yaml'], 'message': "Update environment files for Q upgrade and ffwd upgrade

This consolidates the upgrade and ffwd-upgrade related env files,
removing no longer relevant files (like converge vs converge-docker).

In line with recent/ongoing work in tripleoclient [1][2] we now have
cli: overcloud [upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade] [prepare|run|converge]

With this patch we can also change the set/unset of resource 'noop'
and move it from tripleo-common to python-tripleoclient, like I am
pointing at in related client review below. If others agree then I
will do the same with the upgrade-prepare and also the ffwd cli
in [3], i.e. add explicit inclusion of the upgrade-prepare.yaml
and then similarly include the upgrade-converge.yaml for the
upgrade/ffwd-upgrade converge cli.

Related:
  I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2 python-tripleoclient

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/96ffa3a325544206b2fa542bf52bb76531f7d4d6
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558536/5/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557937/4/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_ffwd_upgrade.py@72

Change-Id: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c
"}]
commit_message:
Update environment files for Q upgrade and ffwd upgrade

This consolidates the upgrade and ffwd-upgrade related env files,
removing no longer relevant files (like converge vs converge-docker).

In line with recent/ongoing work in tripleoclient [1][2] we now have
cli: overcloud [upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade] [prepare|run|converge]

With this patch we can also change the set/unset of resource 'noop'
and move it from tripleo-common to python-tripleoclient, like I am
pointing at in related client review below. If others agree then I
will do the same with the upgrade-prepare and also the ffwd cli
in [3], i.e. add explicit inclusion of the upgrade-prepare.yaml
and then similarly include the upgrade-converge.yaml for the
upgrade/ffwd-upgrade converge cli.

Related:
  I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2 python-tripleoclient

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/96ffa3a325544206b2fa542bf52bb76531f7d4d6
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558536/5/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557937/4/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_ffwd_upgrade.py@72

Change-Id: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Amend lower constraints according to tools/fix-lower-constraints.py and
remove setuptools from requirements.txt to fix requirements job.

Change-Id: I4f336ce65904b5fde9b088a2624fb9196623e295
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E266 too many leading '#' for block comment
- E501 line too long
- H903  Windows style line endings not allowed in code

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I1fd3357479bb2ba3d89de92739ffac99900761b6
(cherry picked from commit 7a714aeb13e99b95a8f495765a1fa57297f92d30)

subject: Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 19:07:28.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/pacemaker/haproxy_with_vip.pp'], 'message': 'Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586
(cherry picked from commit 2131880c710d04d1d6030f02f9e257bbfe14d339)
'}]
commit_message:
Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586
(cherry picked from commit 2131880c710d04d1d6030f02f9e257bbfe14d339)

commit_message:
Adding missing OVN Metadata service to DVR environments

Current environment files for DVR setups using OVN as a backend are
missing Metadata service. This patch is adding it for both HA and non
HA configurations.

Change-Id: I9bf016e838f193918dc74278b1aaaaa8e7919421
Closes-Bug: 1763044
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move requirements for the optional drivers (amqp1, kafka)

Move the requirements for the optional drivers to
test-requirements.txt and setup.cfg.  The default rabbitmq driver's
dependencies should be the only hard requirements for the base
package.

Leaving ZeroMQ deps unchanged for now as it will be removed in Stein

Change-Id: I19dd699ccf87e43202ccefb99258fbaa9ea17b7e

subject: Make the broker timeout when sharding configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 18:06:14.000000000', 'files': ['etc/container-server.conf-sample', 'swift/container/sharder.py'], 'message': "Make the broker timeout when sharding configurable

This is a bit of a blunt tool -- might be better to do a temporary boost
when recording progress, based on the amount of time spent *making* that
progress like in manage_shard_ranges -- but I definitely *don't* want to
get through a 4 hour cleave and then *fail to record that*.

Default to 60s, which is more than twice the default timeout, but give
operators the option to set it as they like.

Change-Id: If518d503b0995051f7dafcbb73ac3c9889fe450f
"}]
commit_message:
Make the broker timeout when sharding configurable

This is a bit of a blunt tool -- might be better to do a temporary boost
when recording progress, based on the amount of time spent *making* that
progress like in manage_shard_ranges -- but I definitely *don't* want to
get through a 4 hour cleave and then *fail to record that*.

Default to 60s, which is more than twice the default timeout, but give
operators the option to set it as they like.

Change-Id: If518d503b0995051f7dafcbb73ac3c9889fe450f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-20 20:03:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't log a warning for InstanceNotFound with deleted VIFs

Similar to Ic2557ae5ba02924749c4c2b762a7f510483f1046, if
nova gets a network-vif-deleted event, the instance could
be getting deleted and the virt driver detach_interface()
method can raise InstanceNotFound, which would result in
a warning log about something we don't actually need to
care much about. This changes that to a debug level message
for the InstanceNotFound case.

I counted this warning showing up 39 times in a single-node
successful tempest run.

Change-Id: Iacc35d594a9584438d0bcb39b24941e0e7fdecab
Related-Bug: #1741075
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log a warning for InstanceNotFound with deleted VIFs

Similar to Ic2557ae5ba02924749c4c2b762a7f510483f1046, if
nova gets a network-vif-deleted event, the instance could
be getting deleted and the virt driver detach_interface()
method can raise InstanceNotFound, which would result in
a warning log about something we don't actually need to
care much about. This changes that to a debug level message
for the InstanceNotFound case.

I counted this warning showing up 39 times in a single-node
successful tempest run.

Change-Id: Iacc35d594a9584438d0bcb39b24941e0e7fdecab
Related-Bug: #1741075

commit_message:
Annotate network parameters for sort_key

Add a 'is_sort_key' keyword for each network's attribute that can
be used as a sort_key. In the future, we will rely on this keyword
to perform validation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/ .

Change-Id: I6104a1b534a7ddc4856bd1a25d77e12b1ed5421f
Related-Bug: #1749820

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints values to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Update msgpack to >=0.5.0 because 0.4.0 is no longer available on PyPI
and we need the lower bound to match the lower constraint.

Change-Id: Ic692cc024bc60b1913fb9eac60be92f7dd353a89
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Sync hacking requirement with ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 12:11:11.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Sync hacking requirement with ironic

Older hacking appears to break our coinstallability in devstack, as
devstack will install test-requirements.txt, and pbr for some reason
imports modules while installing. Older hacking depends on older flake8
depends on older pep8/pycodestyle, and newer pycodestyle doesn't have a
module named pep8 (which older flake8 uses).

http://logs.openstack.org/62/511162/43/check/ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant/c201a8a/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-04-12_08_39_09_868

Also update the tenacity lower-constraints patch to correspond with the
minimum in requirements.txt, else CI will fail on this.

Change-Id: I395734a8ef52319a1f30c04dd5536673686c2d44
(cherry picked from commit 3ceed50e8039f6d67ece1a61942d662e2239194c)
"}]
commit_message:
Sync hacking requirement with ironic

Older hacking appears to break our coinstallability in devstack, as
devstack will install test-requirements.txt, and pbr for some reason
imports modules while installing. Older hacking depends on older flake8
depends on older pep8/pycodestyle, and newer pycodestyle doesn't have a
module named pep8 (which older flake8 uses).

http://logs.openstack.org/62/511162/43/check/ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant/c201a8a/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-04-12_08_39_09_868

Also update the tenacity lower-constraints patch to correspond with the
minimum in requirements.txt, else CI will fail on this.

Change-Id: I395734a8ef52319a1f30c04dd5536673686c2d44
(cherry picked from commit 3ceed50e8039f6d67ece1a61942d662e2239194c)

commit_message:

subject: Fix fetching own shard range from root during audit
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-12 21:17:25.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "Fix fetching own shard range from root during audit

Using the 'includes' param is unreliable when trying to fetch a
specific shard range from the root container because it may match
another overlapping shard range and only the first match will be
returned.  Specifying the shard range name would be specific but is
not currently supported by the container server API, so using marker
and end_marker is a sufficient solution. This has the additional,
unintended, advantage of returning the desired shard range *plus* any
overlapping ranges, which might be useful in the future should the
audit process attempt to correct overlaps.

Change-Id: I4099e53fe5bc91f612ea9905cab724f2298826d5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fetching own shard range from root during audit

Using the 'includes' param is unreliable when trying to fetch a
specific shard range from the root container because it may match
another overlapping shard range and only the first match will be
returned.  Specifying the shard range name would be specific but is
not currently supported by the container server API, so using marker
and end_marker is a sufficient solution. This has the additional,
unintended, advantage of returning the desired shard range *plus* any
overlapping ranges, which might be useful in the future should the
audit process attempt to correct overlaps.

Change-Id: I4099e53fe5bc91f612ea9905cab724f2298826d5

subject: Don't force unicode strings for UUID coercion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 21:05:59.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py'], 'message': 'Don't force unicode strings for UUID coercion

Change Ic6b6308fb1960ec40407e6efde30137b64543e72 attempts to
fix difference between Python 2 and Python 3 values by switching
from using str() to formatting into a unicode string (u"%s").

This is equivalent to changing str() to unicode(), but that is
not correct for expected default string types for Python 2.
This requires either using six.text_type(), or just formatting
into a string, without forcing unicode ("%s"), to be correct on
either runtime.

Change-Id: I178f14cdc670d7a696778891e587ef75de208fc2
Closes-bug: #1763179
'}]
commit_message:
Don't force unicode strings for UUID coercion

Change Ic6b6308fb1960ec40407e6efde30137b64543e72 attempts to
fix difference between Python 2 and Python 3 values by switching
from using str() to formatting into a unicode string (u"%s").

This is equivalent to changing str() to unicode(), but that is
not correct for expected default string types for Python 2.
This requires either using six.text_type(), or just formatting
into a string, without forcing unicode ("%s"), to be correct on
either runtime.

Change-Id: I178f14cdc670d7a696778891e587ef75de208fc2
Closes-bug: #1763179

subject: Fix meter-label-rule creation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 9609, 'name': 'leegayeon', 'email': 'insummer17@gmail.com', 'username': 'leegayeon'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 15309, 'name': 'zhaobo', 'email': 'bzhaojyathousandy@gmail.com', 'username': 'ZhaoBo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-03 09:20:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/metering/drivers/iptables/iptables_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/metering/drivers/test_iptables.py'], 'message': 'Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913
'}]
commit_message:
Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913

commit_message:
Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966
Change-Id: I8bf80efc04883cd754c19bea0303064080112c6e
(cherry picked from commit f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c)

commit_message:
Remove any old client actions that no longer exist

Some clients have removed old deprecated client calls. The mapping.json
still contained references to these causing lots of spurious error
logging.

Change-Id: I64bab08ae4800969dc28d477c1de5bea836af9d1
Closes-Bug: #1744962

commit_message:
Add the docker group to the mistral user

This allows the workflow driven container prepare to make local docker
calls, which is required for pull/push calls to work when uploading
images to the local registry.

Change-Id: Idcb5a104a3875be0831a134e11ab44bb315b510e
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Allowing Non-IP Traffic in L2 and L3 domains

Non-IP traffic is allowed in L2 and L3 Domains
The default_allow_non_ip setting determines if non-ip traffic is
allowed in Nuage specific L2 and L3 domains.

subject: Handle a stestr results directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-28 15:50:40.000000000', 'files': ['grenade.sh'], 'message': 'Handle a stestr results directory

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

This was Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b but the change
was abandoned, I cannot seem to restore it.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19c
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
'}]
commit_message:
Handle a stestr results directory

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

This was Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b but the change
was abandoned, I cannot seem to restore it.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19c
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

subject: Switch heat-engine workers to use os_workers_heat_engine
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-13 14:47:34.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/engine.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/heat-engine-workers-8ef3960a29c21a57.yaml', 'spec/classes/heat_engine_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Switch heat-engine workers to use os_workers_heat_engine

Previously the default value for the heat-engine workers setting was set
to $::os_service_default. We usually use our specific facts for the
worker settings so this change switches it to use the
$::os_worker_heat_engine fact.

Change-Id: I6a8d745b76afca1b1958816fa10a3f1dd30face6
Related-Bug: #1763671
'}]
commit_message:
Switch heat-engine workers to use os_workers_heat_engine

Previously the default value for the heat-engine workers setting was set
to $::os_service_default. We usually use our specific facts for the
worker settings so this change switches it to use the
$::os_worker_heat_engine fact.

Change-Id: I6a8d745b76afca1b1958816fa10a3f1dd30face6
Related-Bug: #1763671

revisions:

keystone is using 'keystone' as default control_exchange [1], barbican needs
to match the value so it could consume related events notifications.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/conf/__init__.py#L90

Change-Id: I16c0fb7e79545268b058eb6fd1a006a04e3fb61b

commit_message:
Configure control_exchange to match keystone

keystone is using 'keystone' as default control_exchange [1], barbican needs
to match the value so it could consume related events notifications.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/conf/__init__.py#L90

Change-Id: I16c0fb7e79545268b058eb6fd1a006a04e3fb61b

subject: Remove python_runtime references
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-12 05:44:41.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/neutron-lbaas-dashboard.rb', 'spec/neutron-fwaas-dashboard_spec.rb', 'spec/neutron-lbaas-dashboard_spec.rb', 'recipes/neutron-fwaas-dashboard.rb'], 'message': 'Remove python_runtime references

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing
python_runtime to openstack-common, the resource executes once in a
given Chef run, instead of attempting to reinstall python multiple
times.

Change-Id: I2e17d655c86fac63e02aaadf5321bc95e2c7aa0b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove python_runtime references

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing
python_runtime to openstack-common, the resource executes once in a
given Chef run, instead of attempting to reinstall python multiple
times.

Change-Id: I2e17d655c86fac63e02aaadf5321bc95e2c7aa0b

commit_message:
Fix create_vnffgd cannot get description from TOSCA file

- Fix create_vnffgd cannot get 'description' and 'name'
from TOSCA yaml file
- Delete redundant 'description' line in vnffgd template
file following the standard in vnffg_usage_guide.rst

Change-Id: I9c384678058c5e27239e9afc8cc2ae1de01ff750
Closes-Bug: #1751433

subject: Remove python_runtime references
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 05:30:19.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/setup.rb'], 'message': 'Remove python_runtime references

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing
python_runtime to openstack-common, the resource executes once in a
given Chef run, instead of attempting to reinstall python multiple
times.

Change-Id: Ife452a1e21a82c877f4aceb85d768ed2f758e0de
'}]
commit_message:
Remove python_runtime references

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing
python_runtime to openstack-common, the resource executes once in a
given Chef run, instead of attempting to reinstall python multiple
times.

Change-Id: Ife452a1e21a82c877f4aceb85d768ed2f758e0de

commit_message:
Spec for isolating configuration of placement database

This spec provides an optional configuration setting that allows the
placement database to be managed separately from the nova api database.
As described in the spec this will help with extraction of placement and
also provide some options for how people manage data when they want to
migrate.

This spec describes work that is already in progress, linked within.

blueprint optional-placement-database

Change-Id: I7c36e54828da5576cb4093deb49a5fdcd667b4e7

subject: Handle special characters when parsing roles.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-16 06:42:26.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/update/create-update-scripts.yaml', 'tasks/upgrade/create-upgrade-scripts.yaml'], 'message': "Handle special characters when parsing roles.

In some cases, the generated ansible-inventory
doesn't organize the vars section indenting them,
but includes them into brackets.
The awk statement didn't take this into account and
the '}' character was being included as part of the
role name, ex: 'Controller}'.

(cherry picked from commit 9cb62d90358380409cca673fc9afc68ed1f1e630)

Change-Id: Ida497d60202dff1a73a3cdf88008ccb3c7ba998d
"}]
commit_message:
Handle special characters when parsing roles.

In some cases, the generated ansible-inventory
doesn't organize the vars section indenting them,
but includes them into brackets.
The awk statement didn't take this into account and
the '}' character was being included as part of the
role name, ex: 'Controller}'.

(cherry picked from commit 9cb62d90358380409cca673fc9afc68ed1f1e630)

Change-Id: Ida497d60202dff1a73a3cdf88008ccb3c7ba998d

commit_message:
Pass env-files and roles-data file to update/upgrade prepare cli.

To bypass issue described in RHBZ#1541024 it's needed to pass
 all the environment files, used during initial overcloud deploy,
to the 'overcloud update|upgrade prepare' cli.

Depends-On: I9db2c9256ed20d4d0b74bb467ee6ae0a9633bcc8
Change-Id: I9b488d84fa6e86ed9ce03c7b5fda5d42f713724d
(cherry picked from commit 937274088c25b20ead6ec41d1622888898b67eb4)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-04-16 08:14:17.000000000', 'files': ['environments/lifecycle/ffwd-upgrade-converge.yaml', 'environments/lifecycle/ffwd-upgrade-prepare.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-converge-docker.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-composable-steps.yaml', 'environments/fast-forward-upgrade.yaml', 'environments/lifecycle/upgrade-converge.yaml', 'environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-converge.yaml'], 'message': "Update environment files for Q upgrade and ffwd upgrade

This consolidates the upgrade and ffwd-upgrade related env files,
removing no longer relevant files (like converge vs converge-docker).

In line with recent/ongoing work in tripleoclient [1][2] we now have
cli: overcloud [upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade] [prepare|run|converge]

With this patch we can also change the set/unset of resource 'noop'
and move it from tripleo-common to python-tripleoclient, like I am
pointing at in related client review below. If others agree then I
will do the same with the upgrade-prepare and also the ffwd cli
in [3], i.e. add explicit inclusion of the upgrade-prepare.yaml
and then similarly include the upgrade-converge.yaml for the
upgrade/ffwd-upgrade converge cli.

Related:
  I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2 python-tripleoclient

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/96ffa3a325544206b2fa542bf52bb76531f7d4d6
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558536/5/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py

Change-Id: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c
"}]
commit_message:
Update environment files for Q upgrade and ffwd upgrade

This consolidates the upgrade and ffwd-upgrade related env files,
removing no longer relevant files (like converge vs converge-docker).

In line with recent/ongoing work in tripleoclient [1][2] we now have
cli: overcloud [upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade] [prepare|run|converge]

With this patch we can also change the set/unset of resource 'noop'
and move it from tripleo-common to python-tripleoclient, like I am
pointing at in related client review below. If others agree then I
will do the same with the upgrade-prepare and also the ffwd cli
in [3], i.e. add explicit inclusion of the upgrade-prepare.yaml
and then similarly include the upgrade-converge.yaml for the
upgrade/ffwd-upgrade converge cli.

Related:
  I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2 python-tripleoclient

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/96ffa3a325544206b2fa542bf52bb76531f7d4d6
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558536/5/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557937/4/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_ffwd_upgrade.py@72

commit_message:
Use EXTRA_TABS/EXTRA_STEPS mechanism to handle manila quotas

The previous manila-ui approach to show shared-file-system default
quotas is too hacky and fragile as the bug reveals.
This commit applies EXTRA_TABS/EXTRA_STEPS plugin interface
introduced to horizon in Rocky to show the manila quota tab
in the default quotas table and quota related forms.

monkey-patching from manila quotas has been dropped.

Note that EXTRA_STEPS feature is being reviewd in horizon
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560679/ so workflow steps related to
manila in the project quota form and the default quota form are not
shown until the corresponding horizon feature is merged.
However, this commit will unblock manila-ui CI so I believe this is
a good compromise.

Note that manila support in the project overview panel is dropped
temporarily as further refactoring in the project overview panel
is being done in horizon side (which will land in Rocky-2).

Closes-Bug: #1759340
Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I22ed7d757c5e5e902f1e85a15c33b34de6c609f1

This was initially tested with using --skip-tags for the

commit_message:
mnaio service setup skips shade install if using tags instead of skip-tags

This was initially tested with using --skip-tags for the
create_network, create_images or create_flavors so you could
skip the ones you want. A task to install shade however is
skipped if someone uses --tags to specify a single tag. For
both to work, I'm adding an always tag to it.

Change-Id: Ia012a2417c8d6b10698ffe0c0712497eba8f4423
Closes-Bug: 1763080

subject: Clear binding:host_id when a subport is removed from a trunk
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-04 15:10:25.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py'], 'message': "Clear binding:host_id when a subport is removed from a trunk

In networking-ovn we set the binding:host_id of a subport to its
parent's. However, when we remove the subport, that info remains there
so if that port would be reused on a trunk which is on a different host,
it will not get bound to the Chassis by ovn-controller, thus it won't
transition to 'up' and never become ACTIVE in Neutron. Tempest test
test_trunk_subport_lifecycle exercises this but the failure doesn't show
up in the gate since both servers are spawned in the same host (we don't
have multinode jobs in the gate).

This patch clears up the host_id when the subport is removed from its
trunk.

Closes-Bug: #1761194
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iea31cb3dd418e086c43a797236c4b71d432422f7
"}]
commit_message:
Clear binding:host_id when a subport is removed from a trunk

In networking-ovn we set the binding:host_id of a subport to its
parent's. However, when we remove the subport, that info remains there
so if that port would be reused on a trunk which is on a different host,
it will not get bound to the Chassis by ovn-controller, thus it won't
transition to 'up' and never become ACTIVE in Neutron. Tempest test
test_trunk_subport_lifecycle exercises this but the failure doesn't show
up in the gate since both servers are spawned in the same host (we don't
have multinode jobs in the gate).

This patch clears up the host_id when the subport is removed from its
trunk.

Closes-Bug: #1761194
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iea31cb3dd418e086c43a797236c4b71d432422f7

subject: Fix K8s API access through LBaaS on gates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 14:45:57.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/lib/kuryr_kubernetes'], 'message': 'Fix K8s API access through LBaaS on gates

In the gate K8s API was inaccessible through the LB we create for it.
This means that we could only connect to the API directly through
HOST_IP.

This commit fixes the issue by adding required iptables rule that allows
traffic to the LB and fixes up the member IP added to the LB.

Change-Id: Icd53ec45a479d54015d0506fb5e8bb9896d0a9df
Related-Bug: 555040
(cherry picked from commit 49470991adedbf047567938e5c6c7f2695e62786)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix K8s API access through LBaaS on gates

In the gate K8s API was inaccessible through the LB we create for it.
This means that we could only connect to the API directly through
HOST_IP.

This commit fixes the issue by adding required iptables rule that allows
traffic to the LB and fixes up the member IP added to the LB.

Change-Id: Icd53ec45a479d54015d0506fb5e8bb9896d0a9df
Related-Bug: 555040
(cherry picked from commit 49470991adedbf047567938e5c6c7f2695e62786)

commit_message:
FFU: Use yum shell instead of ansible yum module

Ansible yum module installs all packages available in the repo
 if you use asterix. We instead will use yum -y update name*.

Change-Id: I8e71367ae91faa06313711c6a954c61af705fd8f
Resolves: rhbz#1549845

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: EVPN linuxbridge driver, catch unplug exception

On a VIF unplug, when the bridge was already removed, an
exception was raised.

This change catches this exception to allow processing
to proceed.

Change-Id: I3689af43ecffba2a8c3fd5e5916e127a7142a68c
Closes-Bug: 1764353

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-27 18:07:37.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'message': "Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130
(cherry picked from commit db081a75c5d2b7a99b4b796f9de7a4aadd7ab522)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130
(cherry picked from commit db081a75c5d2b7a99b4b796f9de7a4aadd7ab522)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I941682ba1eff26bbfcb0c119deb7479c92d35be2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-16 10:02:38.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/update/main.yml', 'tasks/upgrade/main.yml'], 'message': "Ensure ansible-pacemaker installation for updates/upgrades.

The ansible-pacemaker module is needed in
the undercloud to run some of the updates/upgrades
tasks. It's generaly installed during 'undercloud
upgrade' step, but as in CI we're using a mixed

commit_message:
Ensure ansible-pacemaker installation for updates/upgrades.

The ansible-pacemaker module is needed in
the undercloud to run some of the updates/upgrades
tasks. It's generaly installed during 'undercloud
upgrade' step, but as in CI we're using a mixed
version deployment the 'undercloud upgrade' step
is being skipped.

Change-Id: I0c8a36a06bc0f078031fafbafbbdee923a459339
Closes-Bug: #1758880
(cherry picked from commit e2fbfae3edf632f897abb46d4e572a082ba1e76b)

underclouds, meaning it won't reenable non-default undercloud services
by accident.

commit_message:
Merge undercloud service env files into undercloud env files

Upto now we had to explicitly pass extra environment files to
undercloud deploy command line to enable non-default services. Add the
necessary registry entries to undercloud.yaml and docker-uc.yaml so
that we don't have to do that.

Change-Id: I0cf87affde7333fd5844fb3112d58dda043d6a39

Drop Undercloud* resource registry entries

registry entry names for undercloud and overcloud services, so the
Undercloud* names will no longer be needed.

subject: Fix kernel post-installation script
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-13 12:58:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/drivers/kvm/nova_kernel_permissions.yml', 'files/nova_kernel_permissions'], 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)

commit_message:
Get rid of Undercloud* specific service entries in resource registry

Instead of having separate resource registry entries for services
which should be disabled by default on underclouds, no-op them in
environments/undercloud.yaml. This should make it more DRY and we
don't have to keep adding new container image parameters (after all
they are the same services).

Depends-On: I9c7b4318da2a31e3639b9cc83cc11f91ed0cd6f3
Change-Id: I9be5b68529c2b339ba6ffc259add2b7766f3cc54

commit_message:
Don't pass service env files to undercloud deploy

They have been included by default in the undercloud env files in
change I0cf87affde7333fd5844fb3112d58dda043d6a39.

Also in the spirit of change I24a6021d19ffe74760f9897e9bf3453742939bc9
we now use --output-env-file param for image prepare, for clearer
differentiation between inputs and outputs.

Change-Id: I6d61dee8c19f708bc834a497593122f23ef2baf4
Depends-On: I0cf87affde7333fd5844fb3112d58dda043d6a39
