subject: Fix kernel post-installation script
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-13 12:58:24.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/drivers/kvm/nova_kernel_permissions.yml', 'files/nova_kernel_permissions'], 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)

commit_message:
Create log directories for mysql and redis bundles

This is to make mysql and redis bundles log into conventional
container log directories. The other part of the fix will be to edit
the bundle definitions in puppet-tripleo. Also, the host_prep_tasks
create the readme.txt file with directions, as in other services.

Change-Id: Ic8048b25a33006a3fb5ba9bf8f20afd2de2501ee
Partial-Bug: #1731969

commit_message:
Modify vhost user socket directory's default value in environment file

From ocata, the vhost socket directory requires a different set of
permissions from the default directory (/var/run/openvswitch). Modifying
the directory to a new agreed directory which will be created in puppet.
Closes-Bug: #1687993
Depends-On: I255f98c40869e7508ed01a03a96294284ecdc6a8

Change-Id: I77250ca84c9da2fb5a8381e6f60234f8a05cbf12

subject: doc: Clarify about metadata port owner and port status
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-03 10:31:20.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/design/metadata_api.rst'], 'message': "doc: Clarify about metadata port owner and port status

In networking-ovn, the metadata port is created under owner network:dhcp
so that it gets auto deleted when the network is removed. Also, this
port will be used to reach the DHCP when there's no gateway setup.
Compared to ML2/OVS, it can confuse operators when they still see a DHCP
port even though the network was created with the --no-dhcp flag. Plus,
as this is a distributed port (OVN localport), it will not get bound to
any chassis and it'll remain DOWN.

This patch is adding this information to the metadata design documentation.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id12b57455ff30eab37a593b85a15313fafd32638
"}]
commit_message:
doc: Clarify about metadata port owner and port status

In networking-ovn, the metadata port is created under owner network:dhcp
so that it gets auto deleted when the network is removed. Also, this
port will be used to reach the DHCP when there's no gateway setup.
Compared to ML2/OVS, it can confuse operators when they still see a DHCP
port even though the network was created with the --no-dhcp flag. Plus,
as this is a distributed port (OVN localport), it will not get bound to
any chassis and it'll remain DOWN.

This patch is adding this information to the metadata design documentation.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id12b57455ff30eab37a593b85a15313fafd32638

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-04-13 09:54:12.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovn_api.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_router.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn_scheduler.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn_scheduler.py'], 'message': "L3HA: Take priorities into account in least loaded scheduling

This patch is implementing an algorithm to take the priorities of
the gateway ports into account when choosing a chassis using the
Least Loaded policy (default). Prior to this patch, the same chassis

Now, when a new gateway is being scheduled, it will take into

in the event that one of the nodes go down.

Closes-Bug: 1762694

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
L3HA: Take priorities into account in least loaded scheduling

This patch is implementing an algorithm to take the priorities of
the gateway ports into account when choosing a chassis using the
Least Loaded policy (default). Prior to this patch, the same chassis
would always be selected leading to an unbalanced distribution
of the gateway nodes.

Now, when a new gateway is being scheduled, it will take into
account the current priorities and will select the nodes and their
priorities accordingly so that the system remains balanced even
in the event that one of the nodes go down.

Also, I'm adding a new functional test which will check that the
ports have been scheduled as expected by looking directly into the
Southbound database.

Please, note that bug 1762691 could still make routers to not
be in HA mode and we need to address this issue separately.

Closes-Bug: 1762694
Change-Id: I2df35cc31e856b9b574b77dc6b5ab5be262a12b7
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

subject: Enable mutable config in Watcher
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-28 20:45:12.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/conf/decision_engine.py', 'watcher/conf/service.py', 'watcher/common/service.py', 'watcher/conf/gnocchi_client.py'], 'message': "Enable mutable config in Watcher

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
Configuration options are mutable if their oslo.config Opt's
mutable=True is set. This mutable setting is respected when the oslo
method mutate_config_files is called instead of reload_config_files.
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by specifying
the 'restart_method=mutate' parameter, what this patch does.

The default mutable configuration options (set by oslo.config Opts'
mutable=True) are:
- [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version
- [DEFAULT]/debug
- [DEFAULT]/log_config_append

Concrete params, that made mutable in Watcher:

* watcher_decision_engine.action_plan_expiry
* watcher_decision_engine.check_periodic_interval
* watcher_decision_engine.continuous_audit_interval
* gnocchi_client.query_max_retries
* gnocchi_client.query_timeout
* DEFAULT.periodic_interval

Change-Id: If28f2de094d99471a3ab756c947e29ae3d8a28a2
Implements: bp mutable-config
"}]
commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Watcher

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
Configuration options are mutable if their oslo.config Opt's
mutable=True is set. This mutable setting is respected when the oslo
method mutate_config_files is called instead of reload_config_files.
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by specifying
the 'restart_method=mutate' parameter, what this patch does.

The default mutable configuration options (set by oslo.config Opts'
mutable=True) are:
- [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version
- [DEFAULT]/debug
- [DEFAULT]/log_config_append

Concrete params, that made mutable in Watcher:

* watcher_decision_engine.action_plan_expiry
* watcher_decision_engine.check_periodic_interval
* watcher_decision_engine.continuous_audit_interval
* gnocchi_client.query_max_retries
* gnocchi_client.query_timeout
* DEFAULT.periodic_interval

Change-Id: If28f2de094d99471a3ab756c947e29ae3d8a28a2
Implements: bp mutable-config

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I235adfdf373e3693dc5a83a35ae037e157eca6d2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use hiera interpolation for memcached_network

After [1] iptables rules are not set for memcached service
thus services relying on memcached were not functioning well.
With [2] it's requrired to use hiera interpolation for service
configs, this patch fixes it for memcached_network.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551292
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526692

Related-Bug: #1757556
Closes-Bug: #1763009
Change-Id: If9b274192ea4738f455a6106ff1a62eb4e7a5c91

commit_message:
Add always tag where it's needed

When running the nova role with the "nova-config" tag the role will
result in failure due to registered variables not being available. This
change simply adds the always tag where it's needed so that the various
tags in the os_nova role can work together or independently.

Change-Id: Id5e8dd2df3c0cbf7cc2e0cf20b5731928dd6a18d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3cb998becd0666d0d449a961aa784fea458486d3)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I27d40ced965e35f5edcb1200faa5d1693cc12544
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
Co-Authored-By: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DNS Recordset CRUD

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function
we should lookup the ID to use that in the URL,
as the name in the URL will return a 404.

The `name` parameter for a recordset needs to be the full FQDN
including the zone part. Fix the tests accordingly.

Looking up recordsets via name does not work tests for that behaviour
have been removed.

Also harmonised the naming of vars in the recordset
section to make this clearer.

Also add designate to the services deployed for functional tests

These issues with the DNS related cloud functions went undiscovered
for some time because even though there are tests for it,
those get skipped when designate isn't deployed.

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
Co-Authored-By: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>

commit_message:
Ensure ansible-pacemaker installation for updates/upgrades.

The ansible-pacemaker module is needed in
the undercloud to run some of the updates/upgrades
tasks. It's generaly installed during 'undercloud
upgrade' step, but as in CI we're using a mixed
version deployment the 'undercloud upgrade' step
is being skipped.

Change-Id: I0c8a36a06bc0f078031fafbafbbdee923a459339
Closes-Bug: #1758880

commit_message:
Remove useless module_extra_vars in registry.yml

- remove uesless module_extra_vars, this is a historical issue. In the
  past, we use 'docker exec kolla_toolbox ansible xxx' to run module on
  target node, so complex data have to pass through extra_vars. Now we
  are using kolla_toolbox module, no need to use extra_vars anymore.
- Remove some useless until.

Change-Id: I72ed28001202917f9a82a1c3ea33cd6319911ec8

subject: Remove shard_cleanups
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-10 13:55:21.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'swift/container/replicator.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py'], 'message': 'Remove shard_cleanups

shard_cleanups was used to delay the deletion of handoff shard dbs
until all cleaving or misplaced object handling had completed for a
given cycle. The one time this was useful was if a destination shard
for misplaced objects overlapped two source shard ranges. Now, a
destination shard handoff db may be created, replicated and deleted
twice, whereas before it was created and deleted once. This
inefficiency is traded off for deleting handoff shard dbs as soon as
they have been replicated in all other cases.

Change-Id: I1e8408451086fe3ba6057ab5779718484a1a2775
'}]
commit_message:
Remove shard_cleanups

shard_cleanups was used to delay the deletion of handoff shard dbs
until all cleaving or misplaced object handling had completed for a
given cycle. The one time this was useful was if a destination shard
for misplaced objects overlapped two source shard ranges. Now, a
destination shard handoff db may be created, replicated and deleted
twice, whereas before it was created and deleted once. This
inefficiency is traded off for deleting handoff shard dbs as soon as
they have been replicated in all other cases.

Change-Id: I1e8408451086fe3ba6057ab5779718484a1a2775

commit_message:
Skip placement on rebuild in same host

If the instance is rebuilt with a different image in the same
host, we don't need to call placement because there is no change
in resource consumption.

Change-Id: Ie252271ecfd38a0a1c61c26e323cc03869889f0a
Closes-Bug: #1750623

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Iaeed4026962e635f68013ff8d175f0e20bffe415
Closes-Bug: #1763300
(cherry picked from commit 342f723006d3c4bf0c97a4ccc39639c89102b36f)

commit_message:
Update the elk to DB backend

commit_message:
Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966

(cherry picked from commit f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c)

subject: Fix locales on Ubuntu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-14 22:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['templates/prep-scripts/ubuntu_16_prep.sh.j2', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Fix locales on Ubuntu

The new Ubuntu base image we use does not ship with any locales
or locale configuration. A fix[1] attempted to remedy this by
copying the default locale configuration from the host, but it
is not a valid fix since the locale from the host is not present
or generated in the container cache. This causes things to break
on the system when valid locales are used, such as database
systems[2].

Instead, to prepare locales in Ubuntu[3], we should install the
locales package and provide a list of valid locales to prep
the base image. It is not necessary to copy /etc/default/locale
from the system. The first locale provided will be used as
the system's base locale by running 'update-locale' which
builds /etc/default/locale.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/e62de979cbabd2f2c42c5ce5a615c7fa84cd3cfd
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/719241/
[3] https://www.thomas-krenn.com/en/wiki/Configure_Locales_in_Ubuntu#No_locale_set

Change-Id: Iaa5351777d7db464e8a897fdf33c0f440bfa601b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix locales on Ubuntu

The new Ubuntu base image we use does not ship with any locales
or locale configuration. A fix[1] attempted to remedy this by
copying the default locale configuration from the host, but it
is not a valid fix since the locale from the host is not present
or generated in the container cache. This causes things to break
on the system when valid locales are used, such as database
systems[2].

Instead, to prepare locales in Ubuntu[3], we should install the
locales package and provide a list of valid locales to prep
the base image. It is not necessary to copy /etc/default/locale
from the system. The first locale provided will be used as
the system's base locale by running 'update-locale' which
builds /etc/default/locale.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/e62de979cbabd2f2c42c5ce5a615c7fa84cd3cfd
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/719241/
[3] https://www.thomas-krenn.com/en/wiki/Configure_Locales_in_Ubuntu#No_locale_set

Change-Id: Iaa5351777d7db464e8a897fdf33c0f440bfa601b

This BP adds timeout mechanism for event-alarm. End user can specify a
timeout, 0 (no timeout) by default for each event-alarm, and alarm

blueprint event-alarm-timeout

Change-Id: Icff04a0cbfd1322ce8573650c56d180768786389
"}]
commit_message:
Add spec for event-alarm timeout

This BP adds timeout mechanism for event-alarm. End user can specify a
timeout, 0 (no timeout) by default for each event-alarm, and alarm
status becomes 'OK' after timeout without receiving desired event.

blueprint event-alarm-timeout

Change-Id: Icff04a0cbfd1322ce8573650c56d180768786389

subject: Adapt the list of ceph packages for SUSE
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-13 10:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/renamed_variable_python_ceph_package-9575466eb146e500.yaml', 'doc/source/configure-ceph.rst', 'vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/suse-42.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': "Adapt the list of ceph packages for SUSE

SUSE needs more than one distro package for rados support. If
they aren't installed, issues like this [1] appear.

Sadly, the current variable expects only one package name,
and not a list of packages.

This change does the minimum job to make it work, simply
renaming the internal variable (renaming package with
packageS) for readability purposes, and using this new
variable as a list in the provided ``vars/main.yml``.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/openstack-ansible-deploy-ceph-opensuse-423/266bcd0/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-08_07_27_36_061674

Change-Id: I4bb8bb3bc5840fa1d5159ceb91acea83bd5efce4
(cherry picked from commit cf55b9b06638a536fdf87c24b39ab9065a0d1b46
 and I746b27182075b6d55fe2161043768c6692828d64)
"}]
commit_message:
Adapt the list of ceph packages for SUSE

SUSE needs more than one distro package for rados support. If
they aren't installed, issues like this [1] appear.

Sadly, the current variable expects only one package name,
and not a list of packages.

This change does the minimum job to make it work, simply
renaming the internal variable (renaming package with
packageS) for readability purposes, and using this new
variable as a list in the provided ``vars/main.yml``.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/openstack-ansible-deploy-ceph-opensuse-423/266bcd0/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-08_07_27_36_061674

Change-Id: I4bb8bb3bc5840fa1d5159ceb91acea83bd5efce4
(cherry picked from commit cf55b9b06638a536fdf87c24b39ab9065a0d1b46
 and I746b27182075b6d55fe2161043768c6692828d64)

3. Uncap evenlet: uncap eventlet. We will manage the eventlet
   version using constraints now. See the thread starting at
   http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
   for more details.
4. Update RYU to be 4.24 to sort out issues with pip 10

commit_message:
Fix requirements

1. remove unused requirement: mock-requests. This is due to the fact
   that is is unused.
2. Update sphinx
3. Uncap evenlet: uncap eventlet. We will manage the eventlet
   version using constraints now. See the thread starting at
   http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
   for more details.
4. Update RYU to be 4.24 to sort out issues with pip 10

Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Change-Id: I855f88ca09a735054c3582f16d8eff977dc53ce1

commit_message:
Allow vhost socket directory user/group as configurable from template

For ovs2.8 version, it is required to modify the vhost socket directory
permissions as openvswitch:hugetlbfs instead of the earlier hardcoded
values qemu:qemu. Making these values as input which could be configured
from templates.

Change-Id: Ia2d0a49567f51b8e6ecdf1967c515ef0dfe81567
(cherry picked from commit 361785f14d9965b0f81706dfbe3a01550a110b1a)

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ia2e678723fd7769d037df336b992bdcc67be4948
(cherry picked from commit e94947aea41422255d4520f30c3a042bca85cbbf)

subject: Fix ContainerBroker.is_deleted() method
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-12 12:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Fix ContainerBroker.is_deleted() method

Previously is_deleted() failed to consider retiring db objects while
SHARDING nor shard range contents when the container was SHARDED.

Now, the object_count considered in is_deleted() is the same as
that returned in the result of broker.get_info().

In SHARDING or SHARDED states any misplaced objects are *not*
considered in is_deleted.

Change-Id: I62614ea2087d1c6444260823710ea26691b3e894
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ContainerBroker.is_deleted() method

Previously is_deleted() failed to consider retiring db objects while
SHARDING nor shard range contents when the container was SHARDED.

Now, the object_count considered in is_deleted() is the same as
that returned in the result of broker.get_info().

In SHARDING or SHARDED states any misplaced objects are *not*
considered in is_deleted.

Change-Id: I62614ea2087d1c6444260823710ea26691b3e894

subject: Add group configuration to qemu.conf file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-16 07:34:48.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_qemu_spec.rb'], 'message': "Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

Change-Id: I0fa3934b345d51de85fd9d8a5a211b8e1bc50d86
(cherry picked from commit 87e9b300045bb708baf1f0216e6261470de3f04f)
"}]
commit_message:
Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

Change-Id: I0fa3934b345d51de85fd9d8a5a211b8e1bc50d86
(cherry picked from commit 87e9b300045bb708baf1f0216e6261470de3f04f)

commit_message:
use minimal to verify ping/tempest

The minimal config is only used outside of the upstream CI
system.  We cover both ping and tempest upstream but not
across all the releases.  Let's use minimal.yml as the
config that should work across rleases to verify that
both ping and tempest are working correctly from a
CI standpoint.

Change-Id: I23cb01a5f753214897a0e59b4adc45e910fb3cf3

commit_message:
Enable pep8 on the integration directory

Currently trove/integration is disabled for pep8. This patch set
enables pep8 scanning in that directory by removing it from the
exclusion list.  Also, address any issues discovered by enabling
pep8.

Change-Id: I292b6760e96e71abd7019881b95926cba7ce09fe
Closes-Bug: #1642554

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: Ib357336eb165cf642f6793ff6cdde7d53075b158

commit_message:
Re-use undercloud upgrades tasks.

Both upgrades and updates rely on a previous
undercloud upgrade step to run. Currently,
both were implementing its own tasks for upgrading
the undercloud. So, this patch brings them both
together into a single template.

Change-Id: Icb66a4a69bf04c30155999d374b413204df7fc82
(cherry picked from commit f5929d55f86d9c12cc4c01b06a1dec293e5388e2)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 18851, 'name': 'Marius Cornea', 'email': 'mcornea@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcornea'}, {'_account_id': 21537, 'name': 'Yurii Prokulevych', 'email': 'yprokule@redhat.com', 'username': 'yprokule'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26343, 'name': 'Jose Luis Franco', 'email': 'jfrancoa@redhat.com', 'username': 'jfrancoa'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-10 13:30:58.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/update/create-update-scripts.yaml', 'tasks/upgrade/create-upgrade-scripts.yaml'], 'message': "Handle special characters when parsing roles.

In some cases, the generated ansible-inventory
doesn't organize the vars section indenting them,
but includes them into brackets.
The awk statement didn't take this into account and
the '}' character was being included as part of the
role name, ex: 'Controller}'.

Change-Id: Ida497d60202dff1a73a3cdf88008ccb3c7ba998d
"}]
commit_message:
Handle special characters when parsing roles.

In some cases, the generated ansible-inventory
doesn't organize the vars section indenting them,
but includes them into brackets.
The awk statement didn't take this into account and
the '}' character was being included as part of the
role name, ex: 'Controller}'.

Change-Id: Ida497d60202dff1a73a3cdf88008ccb3c7ba998d

subject: Add a note about configuration of ws url
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-11 03:54:37.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install/compute-install-ubuntu.rst'], 'message': "Add a note about configuration of ws url

The common problems that users ran into is that they are not
able to access the container's console in browser (via Horizon).
The reason is that the ws_proxy's URL is not accessible from
the browser. Either the configured IP address is not accessible
from outside or the port was blocked. This patch adds a note to
explain how to configure the websocket proxy's URL propertly.

Change-Id: Ifac45550f22409c2348e1b14ff46606a7bf09a89
(cherry picked from commit e5a9190e1c669e035bb350fb1cb1bf474c668cb4)
"}]
commit_message:
Add a note about configuration of ws url

The common problems that users ran into is that they are not
able to access the container's console in browser (via Horizon).
The reason is that the ws_proxy's URL is not accessible from
the browser. Either the configured IP address is not accessible
from outside or the port was blocked. This patch adds a note to
explain how to configure the websocket proxy's URL propertly.

Change-Id: Ifac45550f22409c2348e1b14ff46606a7bf09a89
(cherry picked from commit e5a9190e1c669e035bb350fb1cb1bf474c668cb4)

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated term, Usage: Action

Replace the deprecated term, Usage: Action, with the new
term, Scope: Public, in the file, Environment.yaml.

This will remove the deprecated warning messages in the
murano-engine log file.

Change-Id: I2f798bac1b2fd60ead1a2396ad1d24def300a33d
Closes-Bug: 1763836

commit_message:
Add openvswitch/hugetlbfs user and group on update

When we bring ovs 2.9 we will need to have openvswitch user
and hugetlbfs group, in order for ovs to work properly. As the
package is not taking care of it, create it on the update tasks.

Co-Authored-By: Zenghui Shi <zshi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I792dd0e1cac1782499413f01b5d40d3b338fd5b1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-15 22:23:17.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'lower-constraints.txt'], 'message': "uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

To pass the gate, this patch also fixes the incompatible lower constraints
that don't match the lower bounds in the requirements files.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iff15cb1fad5d223d5874117d020a6ee909022102
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

To pass the gate, this patch also fixes the incompatible lower constraints
that don't match the lower bounds in the requirements files.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iff15cb1fad5d223d5874117d020a6ee909022102
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Temporarly mark 3node job as non-voting

There's a bug in TestNetworkBasicOps tempest job that prevent patches to
land, and it's impacting 3node job, and the fix for this is creating a
circular dependence.

Change-Id: I339a0fef6b73ba2404d8797b8767fca9cf919664
Related-Bug: 1757556

This spec provides details on how we can break consumer dependencies
on neutron's database model as well as object imports by
exposing neutron objects as entry points that are discoverable and
loadable from neutron-lib. This spec is part of a set of specs related

commit_message:
decouple neutron db models and ovo for neutron-lib

This spec provides details on how we can break consumer dependencies
on neutron's database model as well as object imports by
exposing neutron objects as entry points that are discoverable and
loadable from neutron-lib. This spec is part of a set of specs related
to decoupling the db for neutron-lib (see patch topic).

Change-Id: I079d06502e6e7b1e20aea882979b0ecd9106eaeb

functionality into neutron-lib. It's 1 spec in a set related to

Change-Id: I7b04e202321e1422e53c59c2bab0c85946fcb704

commit_message:
rehome db api and utils into neutron-lib

This spec provides details on how we can break consumer dependencies
on neutron's db API and utilities by rehoming respective generic
functionality into neutron-lib. It's 1 spec in a set related to
decoupling sub-projects from neutron's db logic/layer.

Change-Id: I7b04e202321e1422e53c59c2bab0c85946fcb704

commit_message:
Add microversion to support extra_specs in flavor API.

Exposes flavor extra_specs in the flavor representation since
microversion 2.61. Now users can see the flavor extra-specs
in flavor APIs response only and do not need to call
``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}/extra_specs`` API.

Flavor extra_specs will be included in Response body of the
following APIs:

* ``GET /flavors/detail``
* ``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}``
* ``POST /flavors``
* ``PUT /flavors/{flavor_id}``

Part of blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I048747633babf690a63c6de9773bff5547872053

commit_message:
Add ceph integrated repo testing

Ceph client should exercise the integrated ceph job on demand.
This allows to see if a ceph client change breaks the ceph
jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559781/
Change-Id: I91a23b9b79c497d48cbe6837dd8c9eaaa65e23bf
(cherry picked from commit 93ad121198a17d1e2e24ae446515f4b90fa2dc7f)

commit_message:
add customized mem/cpu for image type function

When creating image type function, allow users to specify cpu
and memory_size resources for the function.

But cpu and memory_size should be integers and within the range
specified in config.py.

Story: 2001586
Task:  6535
Change-Id: I7a5e631701fd652b5f6891bd1444d0135e1463b2

This will need to be converted into a script to run on boot or
similar.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-10 17:59:30.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687
"}]
commit_message:
Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687

commit_message:
Add df_skydive_service to dragonflow

To enable skydive, one should now enable the service in the local.conf
file using the following line:
enable_service df_skydive

If you would like to install the SkyDive analyzer on the same node, the
SkyDive install lines MUST be before the DragonFlow ones!
Please see doc/source/single-node-conf/etcd_skydive_local_controller.conf
file for usage example

Change-Id: I66c3eaf18904ae1c109d0ca8007269c41261d791
Depends-On: c5921051d7bc05d2c29494be842329e2ffcc008a
Related-Bug: #1749429

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints values to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2974d8d119664e6d21decc6f4fc5b16fdb5724a0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Gate: update paths for pip 10 installation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-15 16:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['tools/images/kubeadm-aio/Dockerfile'], 'message': 'Gate: update paths for pip 10 installation

Pip>=10 moves the entrypoint to /usr/local/bin from /usr/bin, this
ps forces the shell to forget all locations following upgrade
to allow it to adapt to the new location.

Change-Id: I1ed92b75f689e982397cd4fc87ac262256e161e8
'}]
commit_message:
Gate: update paths for pip 10 installation

Pip>=10 moves the entrypoint to /usr/local/bin from /usr/bin, this
ps forces the shell to forget all locations following upgrade
to allow it to adapt to the new location.

Change-Id: I1ed92b75f689e982397cd4fc87ac262256e161e8

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib36375525dd11d62d9f5566c714e76876892d9d7
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-13 12:50:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/tables.py', 'releasenotes/notes/delete-update-flavor-feature-6ed1e482b91f5e08.yaml'], 'message': 'Delete the deprecated Edit Flavor feature

Historically, Horizon has provided the ability to edit Flavors by
deleting and creating a new one with the same information. This is not

Closes-Bug: #1751354
'}]
commit_message:
Delete the deprecated Edit Flavor feature

Historically, Horizon has provided the ability to edit Flavors by
deleting and creating a new one with the same information. This is not
supported in the Nova API and causes unexpected issues and breakages.

Change-Id: I796259c66e01be088a50ab6ba63f515de9590c9b
Closes-Bug: #1751354

commit_message:
Test case: ResourceClass.normalize_name with ß

Demonstrates the cited bug by invoking ResourceClass.normalize_name on a
string containing sharp S ('ß').  The result is different for py2 and
py3.

Change-Id: I632995c1a234f26f05ef0b5675e0e22b9866b03d
Related-Bug: #1762789

commit_message:
turn on container updates for upstream multinode

container updates have been turned on for the
3rd party tripleo jobs in software factory [1] since
Jan 24 2018.  I believe this should be reliable
enough for upstream at this point.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/529399/

Change-Id: I8868bf6974fdf268b9deed84c69ff0479df3f080

Revert "unpause Gentoo"

Our elements in project-config don't appear to support gentoo, revert
until we can fix.

  http://nb01.openstack.org/gentoo-17-0-systemd-0000000757.log

This reverts commit b4950fe8a59b6ddc2e8cb15e2ce2846660d1fc55.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make ResourceClass.normalize_name handle sharp S

Fixes ResourceClass.normalize_name to produce the same result in py2 and
py3 even when sharp S ('ß') is part of the input.

We do this by waiting until after replacing non-alphanumerics to upcase.

Change-Id: I431fa29d36d0d633374973fc25168344042d6c1a
Closes-Bug: #1762789

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-13 11:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['roles/nodepool-setup/tasks/clone-ci-repos.yml'], 'message': "Add new line for quickstart-extras-requirement

Review [1] added tripleo-upgrade to quickstart-requirements
and it breaked deployments with reproducer script.
Since ansible copy module doesn't insert new line
in the quickstart-requirements, we need to explicitly
add it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558210/

Change-Id: I10dcef66a0f04765f92ceefcca29be5a79ca4cf0
"}]
commit_message:
Add new line for quickstart-extras-requirement

Review [1] added tripleo-upgrade to quickstart-requirements
and it breaked deployments with reproducer script.
Since ansible copy module doesn't insert new line
in the quickstart-requirements, we need to explicitly
add it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558210/

commit_message:
Fix dstat time penalty for failed runs

dstat async task with poll=0 should fire and forget, with 1 sec
max limit for the shell to run and send its process to bg.

The change includes:
 - Ignore errors on dstat play.
 - Enable dstat only when tempest runs.
 - Kills dstat before parsing logs and creating charts.
 - Remove dstat_count.

Closes-Bug: #1760917

Change-Id: I9ee407e8274f3ab6c3aea3650a25cd31772a81d6

subject: Adding WWW-Authenticate info.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-11 07:24:52.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/context.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_keycloak_auth.py', 'mistral/auth/keycloak.py'], 'message': 'Adding WWW-Authenticate info.

Sometimes when mistral requests are failing with "401 Unauthorized"
against keycloak, the reason are not mentioned in the logs.

In case keycloack return 401 it must provide the www-Authenticate
response header with the reason:
https://www.w3.org/Protocols/HTTP/1.0/spec.html#WWW-Authenticate

This code take care of it by adding the WWW-Authenticate value to
mistral api-log.

Change-Id: I7ae221aaeb2233184bd4818490e72ff662dca5cb
Closes-Bug: #1737500
'}]
commit_message:
Adding WWW-Authenticate info.

Sometimes when mistral requests are failing with "401 Unauthorized"
against keycloak, the reason are not mentioned in the logs.

In case keycloack return 401 it must provide the www-Authenticate
response header with the reason:
https://www.w3.org/Protocols/HTTP/1.0/spec.html#WWW-Authenticate

This code take care of it by adding the WWW-Authenticate value to
mistral api-log.

Change-Id: I7ae221aaeb2233184bd4818490e72ff662dca5cb
Closes-Bug: #1737500

commit_message:
Streamline published release notes

reno isn't really doing stable branches anymore, but its release notes
are set up like it is. Remove 'mainline' title from the primary section.
Then update the 'Newton Series' title to 'Newton and Earlier' to
indicate it's not just capturing Newton itself, but really everything
before 2.0.

Change-Id: Idbc70e270b1a70ffdee1da843cdc234164df05d2

subject: Collapse Unreleased and Mainline sections
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-14 15:32:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/releasenotes/index.rst'], 'message': "Collapse Unreleased and Mainline sections

The current release notes produced have an 'Unreleased' section that
includes the releases back through 2.0.0, then mainline that includes
those release notes as well as 1.5.0 through 0.1.0.

Squish the two so that there is just one copy of each of them. Remove
the explicit mention of origin/master and the earliest-version and just
let the normal reno logic apply.

Change-Id: I02bb2c69b8dd9e866e4efa3437e9c09c33488914
"}]
commit_message:
Collapse Unreleased and Mainline sections

The current release notes produced have an 'Unreleased' section that
includes the releases back through 2.0.0, then mainline that includes
those release notes as well as 1.5.0 through 0.1.0.

Squish the two so that there is just one copy of each of them. Remove
the explicit mention of origin/master and the earliest-version and just
let the normal reno logic apply.

Change-Id: I02bb2c69b8dd9e866e4efa3437e9c09c33488914

This introduces a new PowerVM conf option, proc_units_factor, which can
range from 0.05 to 1.0 and will default to 0.1. It is used to calculate
the physical processing power to assign per vCPU, where 1.0 is a whole

Change-Id: I67bfe2a6eff86f1947ada7661fc7c3fed81ed28f
'}]
commit_message:
PowerVM: Add proc_units_factor conf option

This introduces a new PowerVM conf option, proc_units_factor, which can
range from 0.05 to 1.0 and will default to 0.1. It is used to calculate
the physical processing power to assign per vCPU, where 1.0 is a whole
physical processor and 0.05 is 1/20th of a physical processor.

Change-Id: I67bfe2a6eff86f1947ada7661fc7c3fed81ed28f

commit_message:
Consult the dictionary for root provider ids

For readability, this patch refactors the code getting allocation
candidates. This patch changes _get_providers_with_nested_capacity
to return a simple list of rp_ids rather than a list of tuples,
(rp_ids, root_ids).

Instead, we use the dictionary keyed by rp_ids, "rp_ref_dict".

Change-Id: Ie53c96508da7f74cfa5ded3eec0a069fec276b5d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-09 06:22:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/db/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': 'Improve getting nested providers with capacity

Getting allocation candidates, we at first got all the possible nested
providers with enough resource capacity. But when we know which root
providers can satisfy the request in advance, we should do this in a
more effective way getting only providers that are descendents of
those root providers.

This patch changes _get_providers_with_nested_capacity to accept
root provider ids for its arguments and filter return values to have
only descendents of the root providers.

Change-Id: If833e08bab0ca68764798f72b948384a3fbb6f8a
'}]
commit_message:
Improve getting nested providers with capacity

Getting allocation candidates, we at first got all the possible nested
providers with enough resource capacity. But when we know which root
providers can satisfy the request in advance, we should do this in a
more effective way getting only providers that are descendents of
those root providers.

This patch changes _get_providers_with_nested_capacity to accept
root provider ids for its arguments and filter return values to have
only descendents of the root providers.

Change-Id: If833e08bab0ca68764798f72b948384a3fbb6f8a

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 14:56:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/filters/instance_locality_filter.py'], 'message': 'DNM: Add instance AZ filter for nova instances

The option `cross_az_attach` in nova gives the possibility
to disable cross az attachment of volume on nova vms.
What is missing is a cinder scheduler filter that uses the
instance AZ and filters the corresponding cinder AZs.

WiP / DO NOT MERGE

Change-Id: I3028dbdf08e9f0f815fdcd1796a23def6f328943
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Add instance AZ filter for nova instances

The option `cross_az_attach` in nova gives the possibility
to disable cross az attachment of volume on nova vms.
What is missing is a cinder scheduler filter that uses the
instance AZ and filters the corresponding cinder AZs.

WiP / DO NOT MERGE

Change-Id: I3028dbdf08e9f0f815fdcd1796a23def6f328943

commit_message:
Add volume existence check when we backup it

I think it has already completed the validation
check for container name. So I only add volume
existence check.

Change-Id: I2dce4e60a7b8f29b3c0498cb88c27d2793974a16

As Quobyte based Cinder volumes are files in a

commit_message:
Adds snapshot based backups for Quobyte volumes

Adds local management of snapshot based backups similar to the lvm
implementation (code is based on this).
As Quobyte based Cinder volumes are files in a
shared Quobyte volume the driver can access the snapshots locally
similar to the lvm setup.
Also adds a corresponding unit test and a release note.

Implements: blueprint quobyte-snapshot-backup

Change-Id: I465a908d754cba9f9982a3224c9b86449fc69865

Currently, self.db.snapshot_update is used to update the snapshot info
while creating cgsnapshot, but Snapshot object should be used instead.

Change-Id: Iaa801876b76d54fe3aa49f43b189ddee28963d14
Closes-Bug: #1599022
'}]
commit_message:
Fix snapshot update exception while creating cgsnapshot

Currently, self.db.snapshot_update is used to update the snapshot info
while creating cgsnapshot, but Snapshot object should be used instead.

Change-Id: Iaa801876b76d54fe3aa49f43b189ddee28963d14
Closes-Bug: #1599022

When a user wants to perform parallel cinder image volume
creation operation, 3par driver ends the execution up with
different errors in different test scenarios as described
in bug.

While creating image volumes concurrently on HPE 3PAR, one of the
step is to copy image to volume. And for this copy process, 3par
driver tries to establish connection between host and array. As
the volume creation requests are multiple and concurrent, multiple
requests are being issued for connection between host and array
which should be in sync to avoid deadlock errors.

Closes-Bug: #1658888

Change-Id: I6535ec139e09062248060f4692a721a352c091eb
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: concurrent request creates multiple issues

When a user wants to perform parallel cinder image volume
creation operation, 3par driver ends the execution up with
different errors in different test scenarios as described
in bug.

While creating image volumes concurrently on HPE 3PAR, one of the
step is to copy image to volume. And for this copy process, 3par
driver tries to establish connection between host and array. As
the volume creation requests are multiple and concurrent, multiple
requests are being issued for connection between host and array
which should be in sync to avoid deadlock errors.

Closes-Bug: #1658888

Change-Id: I6535ec139e09062248060f4692a721a352c091eb

commit_message:
Huawei: support for ipv6

Both ipv4 and ipv6 are supported by Huawei cinder driver when attaching
a volume to a VM.

Change-Id: I6fe6c2b226d3863c7eb91e76120d98a6230e0f42
Implements: blueprint ipv6-support

commit_message:
Fix storage pools key of Huawei driver

Storage pools key is incorrect while getting local/remote device of
Huawei driver, this patch changes it to the correct one.

Change-Id: Ic48c5a0ddfbec4b86e6dc62ad7d4b1a86db86f1c
Closes-Bug: #1635500

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-11 06:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Converting string into JSON when cinder takes block_device_mapping value from DB

To reproduce this bug:
1. Boot an instance from a volume.
2. Create an image of this volume-backended instance using nova image-create.
3. Create a new volume using this image.
4. Boot a new instance using this newly created volume.
    -> then booting an instacne fails with the error message below
Invalid image metadata. Error: A list is required in field img_block_device_mapping, not a unicode (HTTP 400)

The cause of this bug is, when creating an image meta object, Cinder passes block_device_mapping value as string to Nova
but the value should be json.

Closes-Bug: #1476114
Change-Id: I6c70f61cc9fc9abc23a36cf33df2e4fc0273bcd4
'}]
commit_message:
Converting string into JSON when cinder takes block_device_mapping value from DB

To reproduce this bug:
1. Boot an instance from a volume.
2. Create an image of this volume-backended instance using nova image-create.
3. Create a new volume using this image.
4. Boot a new instance using this newly created volume.
    -> then booting an instacne fails with the error message below
Invalid image metadata. Error: A list is required in field img_block_device_mapping, not a unicode (HTTP 400)

The cause of this bug is, when creating an image meta object, Cinder passes block_device_mapping value as string to Nova
but the value should be json.

Closes-Bug: #1476114
Change-Id: I6c70f61cc9fc9abc23a36cf33df2e4fc0273bcd4

commit_message:
Remove unused function _build_iscsi_target_name

This function is not used anywhere in the code.
With this function removed, there is no need for a
body for SanISCSIDriver.

Change-Id: Icea18ea98de980ba57d278c2e9512dcfb14ca425

commit_message:
db/sqlalchemy/api: delete in_use value

When the first consistencygroup is created for a new project in
cinder, reserved value can assign to in_use. Thereforce, in_use
value shouldn't be updated.

Change-Id: I77b760655f71e61fd9c299de2da3703f88872293
close-bug: 1693610

commit_message:
Enhance Infortrend driver

Features added:
- Protocol iSCSI supports both MPIO and MCS now.
- Improve Infortrend driver performance.
- Enhance extraspecs usage and refactor retype.
- Support for list manageable volume
- Support for list/manage/unmanage snapshot

Issues fixed:
- Errors for live migration with Infortrend backend.(#1481968)
- Manage-existing issues for using source-name.
- Creating volume on a wrong pool.

Co-Authored-By: billsung <billsung.taiwan@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1481968
Change-Id: I6e9d4c9e4637bf2a5e745f1b02006d5cc898807e

commit_message:
vzstorage: deprecate vzstorage_mount_options

These mount options has never passed to pstorage-mount.
Instead of that mount options should be defined in
shares config file.

Change-Id: Ibadcc88d228c8fd1862db8379f3646f393e7362a
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

commit_message:
Support utf-8 decode

The decode format is not designed in wsgi _process_stack function,
which will cause exception when create volume with Chinese character.
This patch is to fix it.

Change-Id: I8030a83129810baf4b3a1e420152cf81e75ad0a0
Closes-Bug: #1703493

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-02 01:03:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/coordination.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_coordination.py'], 'message': "Support shared lock

Currently we protects create from volume/snapshot by using a
lock to protect the operation from concurrent deletes the
volumes/snapshot used in the create operation, but we use
exclusive locks on both delete and create side which will result
in only one create operations from the same volume/snapshot can
process on the same time.

Since Tooz has supported shared filelock, this patch gives a
optimized method, add exclusive(write) locks for delete
operations and shared(read) locks for create operations, so we
can create from volume/snapshot on parallel and also protect
create operations from concurrent delete the source
volume/snapshot.

It add a 'concurrent_create' config option because some arrays
don't support creating a couple of volumes from the same
volume/snapshot.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I78200911dac2a50d3375de63a4318077b276b0fd
"}]
commit_message:
Support shared lock

Currently we protects create from volume/snapshot by using a
lock to protect the operation from concurrent deletes the
volumes/snapshot used in the create operation, but we use
exclusive locks on both delete and create side which will result
in only one create operations from the same volume/snapshot can
process on the same time.

Since Tooz has supported shared filelock, this patch gives a
optimized method, add exclusive(write) locks for delete
operations and shared(read) locks for create operations, so we
can create from volume/snapshot on parallel and also protect
create operations from concurrent delete the source
volume/snapshot.

It add a 'concurrent_create' config option because some arrays
don't support creating a couple of volumes from the same
volume/snapshot.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I78200911dac2a50d3375de63a4318077b276b0fd

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 08:55:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/coprhd/common.py'], 'message': 'CoprHD: Handle duplicate display naming error

This fix allows an openstack user to create more than 1 resource with same
display names. As CoprHD currently has no support for this, we append a
unique ID to the display name before sending the request to CoprHD.

Logic has been added to append the Openstack Volume ID with the volume
name, this volume ID will only be appended to the volume name in CoprHD.
In Openstack the display name will be shown as provided by the user.

Change-Id: Ie0df89a84a8135851c35825c26ffce600e855843
Closes-Bug: #1653634
'}]
commit_message:
CoprHD: Handle duplicate display naming error

This fix allows an openstack user to create more than 1 resource with same
display names. As CoprHD currently has no support for this, we append a
unique ID to the display name before sending the request to CoprHD.

Logic has been added to append the Openstack Volume ID with the volume
name, this volume ID will only be appended to the volume name in CoprHD.
In Openstack the display name will be shown as provided by the user.

Change-Id: Ie0df89a84a8135851c35825c26ffce600e855843
Closes-Bug: #1653634

An incremental column is added to backups table and it's
default value is false, then 'incremental' can be used
in backup.drivers.ceph.CephBackupDriver.backup. When
volume is rbd and incremental is true, attempt incremental

Change-Id: I9fe912a4aeb4d5ff8a648800c91943c423323514
Close-bug: #1578036
"}]
commit_message:
make incremental effective when cinder-backup create

An incremental column is added to backups table and it's
default value is false, then 'incremental' can be used
in backup.drivers.ceph.CephBackupDriver.backup. When
volume is rbd and incremental is true, attempt incremental
backup.

Change-Id: I9fe912a4aeb4d5ff8a648800c91943c423323514
Close-bug: #1578036

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-30 17:32:27.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/coprhd/helpers/authentication.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nexenta/ns5/jsonrpc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/nimble.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/tegile.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/tintri.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/coprhd/helpers/commoncoprhdapi.py'], 'message': "Nosec verify=False until driver writer review

In an effort to clean up Cinder's Bandit run, issue B501 (Requests call
with verify=False disabling SSL certificate checks) from Bandit
has been nosec'd until the driver implementers are able to implement
this security feature. We decided against blacklisting the Bandit issue
so that future code writers will carefully consider enabling this
security measure.

Change-Id: If88335041807a450849e39e416ec01566c3dde0d
"}]
commit_message:
Nosec verify=False until driver writer review

In an effort to clean up Cinder's Bandit run, issue B501 (Requests call
with verify=False disabling SSL certificate checks) from Bandit
has been nosec'd until the driver implementers are able to implement
this security feature. We decided against blacklisting the Bandit issue
so that future code writers will carefully consider enabling this
security measure.

Change-Id: If88335041807a450849e39e416ec01566c3dde0d

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-01 09:07:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'message': 'Increase existence check for image when create volumes

Obviously, there have some existence check for volumes and snapshot.
However, there has not a existence check for image if we create a
volume from a image. And there must be have some exceptions if image
has been deleted when we create a volume. So this patch is aim to add
a check for image, and avoid to produce such exceptions.

Change-Id: Iaaf2ba7d2d9e52fd5102c31d38f00f2d1602bf4e
Closed-Bug #1644397
'}]
commit_message:
Increase existence check for image when create volumes

Obviously, there have some existence check for volumes and snapshot.
However, there has not a existence check for image if we create a
volume from a image. And there must be have some exceptions if image
has been deleted when we create a volume. So this patch is aim to add
a check for image, and avoid to produce such exceptions.

Change-Id: Iaaf2ba7d2d9e52fd5102c31d38f00f2d1602bf4e
Closed-Bug #1644397

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 17:18:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/cmd/validate_config.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Integrate oslo.config validator

Adds the oslo configuration file validator as a new entry point.

The config validator is a tool intended for use by operators to validate
their modified configuration files before standing up services in production.

Change-Id: Iea7f5408ecaf9750cf13a9a7c20472c01f84d280
Depends-On: I78d3621afda226f5968963ef408507234dfead4c
'}]
commit_message:
Integrate oslo.config validator

Adds the oslo configuration file validator as a new entry point.

The config validator is a tool intended for use by operators to validate
their modified configuration files before standing up services in production.

Change-Id: Iea7f5408ecaf9750cf13a9a7c20472c01f84d280
Depends-On: I78d3621afda226f5968963ef408507234dfead4c

commit_message:
Update wording in @safe_connect placement warnings

We're well past the point of Placement being required,
so this drops the wording about Newton and Ocata and
just makes the warnings say that Placement is required.

Change-Id: I42730e6ef0ac66efe9122ac3078ca15c1071b080

commit_message:
get error information while choosing next page on dashboard

There have been 5 volumes exsit, and 2 volumes per page.
After deleting the second volume in second page,  I get the error
information "Unable to retrieve list of volumes." on dashboard.
cinder should catch the exception when marker is deleted volume.

Change-Id: I9792c05685b3fc6820c75ceea4117eac6cec60a7
Close-Bug: #1672649

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-08 03:32:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/gpfs.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_gpfs.py'], 'message': 'Volume replication support in GPFS driver

GPFS supports data mirroring and replication for high availability
of data. More information can be found at https://ibm.biz/Bdr7kd.
This patch adds the support of replication in GPFS driver by exposing
the underlying capability to the scheduler.

DocImpact
Needs an update in GPFS driver documentation, as this patch introduces
replication support for the GPFS backend.

Change-Id: I776fcb1a29b1b225dd81ead18ab45ab0241c518b
'}]
commit_message:
Volume replication support in GPFS driver

GPFS supports data mirroring and replication for high availability
of data. More information can be found at https://ibm.biz/Bdr7kd.
This patch adds the support of replication in GPFS driver by exposing
the underlying capability to the scheduler.

DocImpact
Needs an update in GPFS driver documentation, as this patch introduces
replication support for the GPFS backend.

Change-Id: I776fcb1a29b1b225dd81ead18ab45ab0241c518b

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-01 08:16:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/driver.py'], 'message': 'Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint linux-ficon-support
Change-Id: I1ba52d83907fd094be7c8480c5a5bf918876caa5
'}]
commit_message:
Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint linux-ficon-support
Change-Id: I1ba52d83907fd094be7c8480c5a5bf918876caa5

commit_message:
Tegile driver doesn't honor create from snapshot volume size

create_volume_from_snapshot can specify a volume size larger than
the original snapshot. Tegile driver doesn't appear to handle this size
difference. This patch fixes it.

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Id8cc82ec9d1565f7cbd38684f6d1a712cfba1cd6
Closes-Bug: #1560640

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-07-28 05:22:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Allow volume migration between different availablity zones

Currently volume migration bewteen different availability zones does not
work. To solve this issue, the following procedue should be done:
1. Add a new configuration item 'enable_across_az_migrate'. If enabled
volume migration between different AZ's will be allowed. Otherwise, not
allowed.
2. Add two volume backend with same 'volume_backend_name'.
3. Allocated different AZ for different backend. After that, restart the
cinder volume service.
4. Migrate volume to the different AZ.

Closes-Bug: #1550353
Change-Id: I444c2b50bcc3842a4f0fe3d74fbfaef89126fc83
"}]
commit_message:
Allow volume migration between different availablity zones

Currently volume migration bewteen different availability zones does not
work. To solve this issue, the following procedue should be done:
1. Add a new configuration item 'enable_across_az_migrate'. If enabled
volume migration between different AZ's will be allowed. Otherwise, not
allowed.
2. Add two volume backend with same 'volume_backend_name'.
3. Allocated different AZ for different backend. After that, restart the
cinder volume service.
4. Migrate volume to the different AZ.

Closes-Bug: #1550353
Change-Id: I444c2b50bcc3842a4f0fe3d74fbfaef89126fc83

and queries which update this table need to need to be modified to
account for this change.

Implements: blueprint ha-db-object-version-counter

commit_message:
Update 'update' queries for transfers table

A new column 'revision_number' is added  to the 'transfers' table
and queries which update this table need to need to be modified to
account for this change.

Implements: blueprint ha-db-object-version-counter
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ide12db59f368a29606a18fa22f84cb88f2965f77

A new column 'revision_number' is added to the 'transfers' table

Implements: blueprint ha-db-object-version-counter
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>

Change-Id: I41c95b7490ac8988d069d302e4565cf2df0b3e00

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertEqual(False, A) and assertEqual(True, A)
use assertFalse(A) and assertTrue(A).
They are compatible with Python 3.5[1]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I0a7b11044b9968de9d9402c1a35b28374487b16c

commit_message:
HPE3PAR: Retype replication volume with provisioning

3PAR cannot change provisioning of replicated
volume, which has remote copy. so the workaround
is to stop the remote copy, change the
provisioning and then start remote copy.

Change-Id: I279f460a55b6bdf7c8f0689307291657e0504ca3
Closes-bug: 1714473

subject: update requirements to support matching global exclusions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-10 18:12:51.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'update requirements to support matching global exclusions

The match for dependency names is case sensitive, so change
"pastedeploy" to "PasteDeploy".

The match for dependencies takes the environment markers into account,
so add a marker for dnspython to restrict its use to python 2.7. There
is a dnspython3 package for use with version 3, and that can be added
separately as part of the python 3 porting work.

Change-Id: Ia2bb2e1846d734609ea9ff37d2ad1ffd37ced950
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560109
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
update requirements to support matching global exclusions

The match for dependency names is case sensitive, so change
"pastedeploy" to "PasteDeploy".

The match for dependencies takes the environment markers into account,
so add a marker for dnspython to restrict its use to python 2.7. There
is a dnspython3 package for use with version 3, and that can be added
separately as part of the python 3 porting work.

Change-Id: Ia2bb2e1846d734609ea9ff37d2ad1ffd37ced950
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560109
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-03-31 12:38:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/config/cloud_region.py', 'openstack/cloud/openstackcloud.py', 'openstack/config/loader.py', 'openstack/config/_util.py', 'releasenotes/notes/make-cloud-region-standalone-848a2c4b5f3ebc29.yaml'], 'message': "Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Leave passing in the OpenStackConfig for now, because osc uses it.
However, if we can get osc shifted to using get_password_callback, we
can get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the need for OpenStackConfig in CloudRegion

There are a few things in CloudRegion that require calling back out to
the creating OpenStackConfig object. However, now that creating a
CloudRegion directly is a thing, those calls have become more awkward.

Shift the cache settings and methods to CloudRegion along with the
extra_config logic. Move two of the utility methods in loader into a
_util file so that both loader and cloud_region can import it. This
renames get_cache_expiration to get_cache_expirations, but I'm fairly
confident that the only consumer of get_cache_expirations here is
openstack.cloud.

Leave passing in the OpenStackConfig for now, because osc uses it.
However, if we can get osc shifted to using get_password_callback, we
can get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ia6ed0f00bfc2483bd09169811198cdf1a0ab2f15

commit_message:
Add tags fields for server list detail/show api-ref

As of the 2.26 microversion, the 'tags' field is in the response for
showing details about a given server, but the tags field is not in
the response table description for that API.

This patch added tags field for server list detail and show API.

Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Idef667d7c8b1cd4781ccd391a481af3d46113f4e
Closes-Bug: #1673628

commit_message:
use sub-resource API extension support

Now that neutron-lib supports sub-resources [1], there's no need for
extension classes to override update_attributes_map and
get_extended_resources to add their own sub-resources. This patch
removes those methods from the qos extensions class.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705

Change-Id: Ibb66246091fd84e18c56009f5fcb8fdea3aff6b7

commit_message:
Add autoescape parameter to jinja env

We create enviroment object and use that to load templates, but this
templates can be changed by user. This can lead to security problems.

Change-Id: I294f49c15d0d7987870c077438af291a6ac6816f

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: volume model update return missing vol id

Create_group_from_src is not returning the volume id along with
the other volume updates. Manager.py uses this to update the db.

Added this id to create_group_from_src return.

Closes-Bug: #1759897
Change-Id: I240df78363182e4e8017f89b67c0f7d7bf6819c8
(cherry picked from commit 430a292b836cde4386c88f467a016ee17fef40eb)

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: volume actions

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume actions API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (attach)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (detach)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (volume_upload_image)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (extend)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (retype)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (initialize_connection)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (terminate_connection)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (set_bootable_status)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action (update_readonly_flag)

Change-Id: I39ede009d5e909a076860df7305865286caa5352
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Additionally:
* add funcsigs to lower-constraints.txt
* set lower-constraint for sphinx=1.6.2

Change-Id: Ia9d795125a00d4bbe6d52738f0d8dc286ed4c676
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Expose shutdown retry interval as config setting

This option is in the driver interface but was hard coded in the manager
class.

Defaults to old value (10 seconds) if not set in configuration file.

Change-Id: I0c8db2efec6098c017aad2f6588938bc548db139

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-13 04:25:48.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_engine_startstop.py'], 'message': 'Catch exceptions when updating service

service_manage_report is periodically called by the engine service
timer.  If an exception occurs during the execution of
service_manage_report, the timer is killed.  This leaves the engine
service to believe it is dead.

With this change any exceptions encountered during service update will
be caught and logged without killing the timer.

The same exception handling is added to service_manage_cleanup.

Closes-Bug: #1763490

Change-Id: Id1ba7f9c815cfebe2b2d269640a6544ababd7ae8
'}]
commit_message:
Catch exceptions when updating service

service_manage_report is periodically called by the engine service
timer.  If an exception occurs during the execution of
service_manage_report, the timer is killed.  This leaves the engine
service to believe it is dead.

With this change any exceptions encountered during service update will
be caught and logged without killing the timer.

The same exception handling is added to service_manage_cleanup.

Closes-Bug: #1763490

Change-Id: Id1ba7f9c815cfebe2b2d269640a6544ababd7ae8

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-27 04:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Add host to API and Conductor

The instance action event is recorded in API/Conductor/Compute using
EventReporter, in order to help admins to find the host of events
occurring we also need pass the host info to EventReporter.

In compute, we already have a self.host on the
nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager, but API/Conductor doesn't contain
this.

In order to get host conveniently, this patch add host to API and
Conductor, and set it to CONF.host when api and conductor initialize.

Part of blueprint: add-host-to-instance-action-events

Change-Id: Idf57fb5fbc611abb83943bd7e36d3cebf03b3977
"}]
commit_message:
Add host to API and Conductor

The instance action event is recorded in API/Conductor/Compute using
EventReporter, in order to help admins to find the host of events
occurring we also need pass the host info to EventReporter.

In compute, we already have a self.host on the
nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager, but API/Conductor doesn't contain
this.

In order to get host conveniently, this patch add host to API and
Conductor, and set it to CONF.host when api and conductor initialize.

Part of blueprint: add-host-to-instance-action-events

Change-Id: Idf57fb5fbc611abb83943bd7e36d3cebf03b3977

commit_message:
Removes odl-dlux-gui feature for ODL

The GUI feature is no longer supported with ODL and needs to be removed.
We relied on the URL provided by this feature in order to run our docker
healtcheck, which is modified in the depends-on patch to a new URI.

Depends-On: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I762789e65913b4f653bbf9019b5d3d05903912f1
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f51f5336798751d9a23b69c4c301f748251a6064)

commit_message:
Fixes ODL healthcheck URI

In the past we used index.html to ensure ODL container was healthy.
This page was provided by the GUI plugins into ODL.  Now that those
plugins are no longer supported, we need to move to a more reliable URI
path.

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9e72a429d1ae1d6be2e747a973be6b6c072cd630)

commit_message:
Change permissions on SSL keys to 640

This tightens up the security on the SSL keys stored in
/etc/apache2/ssl/<service> to be no longer world readable.

This is a backport from master:
cherry-pick: 6470d6dd2c261a74c128004ad1a75e6f134b6691

Change-Id: I5c6349d421f9ee0627dc95797291a466dee7fe37
Related-Bug: #1761305

commit_message:
[placement] Filter allocation candidates by forbidden traits in db

Adjust the generated SQL and surrounding python code to support
expressing forbidden traits when requesting allocation candidates.
Any resource provider which has a forbidden trait will not be
included.

The RequestGroup object now supports a forbidden_traits attribute.
Code in forthcoming patches will adjust the query string processing
that creates a RequestGroup to set that attribute if the calling code
is using the right microversion.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: I53f6fce0810c53551710407df7ab1689282e73f3

commit_message:
[placement] Filter resource providers by forbidden traits in db

This is the db-side work for filtering resource providers by
forbidden traits. Since we control whether forbidden is allowed
or not at the API layer, we can add support here in the DB layer
such that it works all the time.

Subsequent patches will turn on the the functionality in a microversion.

Partially implements blueprint placement-forbidden-traits
Change-Id: I46796d49931df20b002d1a7e6bb3a6be34dabefa
